Metadata.homeTitle: Peer to Peer Car Rental Arizona | Hosts Earn 90% | ItWhip
Metadata.homeDescription: Arizona's #1 peer-to-peer car rental platform. Rent unique cars from local Phoenix owners or list your car and earn up to 90%. $1M insurance included. Phoenix, Scottsdale, Tempe, Mesa, Chandler.
Metadata.searchDescription: Find and rent cars from local owners in {city}. Daily, weekly, and monthly rentals with $1M insurance included.

Home.heroSubheadline: • Fully insured • Hosts earn up to 90% •
Home.noCarsAvailable: No cars available at the moment.
Home.checkBackSoon: Check back soon for new listings.
Home.esgDescription: Low emissions rentals with verified maintenance scores
Home.p2pDescription: Rent directly from verified local hosts
Home.beFirstHost: Be the first host to list your car in {city} and start earning up to 90% of each rental.
Home.browseP2PRentals: Browse peer-to-peer rentals in Phoenix, Scottsdale, Tempe, and other Arizona cities.
Home.insuranceCta: Your earnings are determined ONLY by your insurance.
Home.eventsDescription: Maximize earnings during peak events. Our dynamic pricing adjusts automatically for major Arizona events.
Home.eventBarrettJacksonFull: The world's greatest collector car auction brings 300,000+ visitors to Scottsdale. Premium and luxury vehicle demand skyrockets as enthusiasts seek matching rides.
Home.eventBarrettJacksonTip: List luxury, sports cars, and convertibles. Set premium pricing 2 weeks before the event.
Home.eventPgaOpenFull: The 'Greatest Show on Grass' draws 700,000+ fans over the week. Young professionals and corporate groups need reliable transportation across Scottsdale.
Home.eventPgaOpenTip: SUVs and luxury sedans do well. Airport pickup listings get booked fastest.
Home.eventSpringTrainingFull: 15 MLB teams bring fans from across the country for 5 weeks of baseball. Families and groups need spacious vehicles to visit multiple stadiums across the Valley.
Home.eventSpringTrainingTip: SUVs and minivans are in highest demand. Multi-day bookings are common — offer weekly discounts.
Home.eventArtsFestFull: Scottsdale's premier cultural event features 175+ artists, live entertainment, and culinary experiences. Perfect weather drives convertible and luxury demand.
Home.eventArtsFestTip: Convertibles and luxury vehicles are most popular. Weekend-only listings work well for this event.
Home.eventFilmFestFull: Arizona's largest film festival screens 150+ films over 11 days. Industry professionals and film buffs need reliable transportation.
Home.eventFilmFestTip: Clean, stylish sedans and SUVs are popular. Offer airport delivery for out-of-town guests.
Home.eventStateFairFull: Six weeks of rides, concerts, and food at the Arizona State Fairgrounds. Families from across the state drive demand for spacious, affordable vehicles.
Home.eventStateFairTip: Budget-friendly SUVs and minivans do best. Multi-week bookings are common during the fair.
Home.eventF1Full: The Las Vegas F1 Grand Prix sends overflow visitors to Phoenix — hotels and rental cars sell out in Vegas, driving demand to nearby Arizona.
Home.eventF1Tip: Sports cars and luxury vehicles attract F1 fans. Offer Phoenix airport pickup for Vegas overflow.
Home.eventFiestaBowlFull: College Football Playoff semifinal at State Farm Stadium in Glendale. 70,000+ fans need transportation for the New Year's game.
Home.eventFiestaBowlTip: Airport delivery is key. List spacious vehicles for fan groups traveling together.
Home.eventsSummerCta: 20% auto-discount applied. Premium vehicles for every event.
Home.hostsEarnMore: Hosts earn more during this event. Early booking recommended.

About.heroSubtitle: Arizona's First Desert-Built Car Sharing Platform
About.heroDescription: Connecting vehicle owners with travelers since 2023 • Serving all of Arizona • Building sustainable transportation
About.section1Content:
ItWhip is Arizona's first peer-to-peer car sharing marketplace built specifically for the desert environment. We connect vehicle owners (Hosts) with renters (Guests) through a transparent platform that prioritizes trust, fair earnings, and environmental responsibility.

Since our first ride in 2023 in Phoenix, Arizona, our team has focused on building the best car sharing experience for the Southwest. We understand Arizona's unique needs—from the extreme summer heat to the diverse terrain spanning desert valleys to mountain retreats.

Unlike traditional rental companies, ItWhip offers hosts up to 90% of rental earnings based on their insurance tier. Our Mileage Forensics™ system provides complete transparency for every trip, while MaxAC™ certification ensures every vehicle is tested for Arizona's extreme heat.

Today, ItWhip serves 18 cities across Arizona, including Phoenix, Scottsdale, Tempe, Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Sedona, Tucson, and Flagstaff—covering everything, everywhere across the state.

Our platform offers diverse vehicle options: economy cars for daily errands, luxury vehicles for special occasions, SUVs for outdoor adventures, and everything in between. Whether arriving at Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport or exploring Sedona's red rocks, ItWhip has the perfect vehicle for your journey.
About.section2Mission: To democratize transportation access by creating a trusted marketplace that empowers vehicle owners to generate income while providing travelers with affordable, quality mobility solutions.
About.section2CommunityFirst:
Community First:
We believe in the power of community. Every vehicle shared strengthens our local economy, with hosts earning an average of $850 per month in supplemental income. We're not just a platform - we're neighbors helping neighbors.
About.section2Trust:
Trust & Safety:
Your safety is our priority. Every host and guest goes through comprehensive verification, including identity checks and driving record reviews. All trips include up to $1 million in liability protection, giving you peace of mind on every journey.
About.section2Transparency:
Transparency:
No hidden fees, no surprises. Our pricing is clear and upfront. Hosts keep 40-90% of rental revenue based on their insurance tier - the most flexible in the industry. Guests see the total cost before booking. We believe honest business is good business.
About.section2Sustainability:
Sustainability:
Car sharing reduces the need for vehicle ownership and decreases urban congestion. One shared vehicle on ItWhip replaces 9-13 privately owned cars, reducing CO2 emissions by 3.4 tons annually per vehicle. We're committed to a greener Phoenix.
About.section2Innovation:
Innovation:
We leverage cutting-edge technology to make car sharing seamless. From instant booking to contactless pickup, embedded insurance to real-time support, we're constantly improving the experience for our community.
About.section2Accessibility:
Accessibility:
Transportation should be available to everyone. We offer multiple payment options, no credit check requirements for basic rentals, and maintain affordable pricing to ensure our service is accessible to all Phoenix residents and visitors.
About.section3GuestFinding:
Finding Your Perfect Vehicle:
Browse our growing fleet of 100+ vehicles across Arizona, from economical daily drivers to luxury experiences. Each listing includes detailed photos, features, and reviews from previous renters. Our search filters help you find exactly what you need, when you need it.
About.section3GuestBooking:
Simple Booking Process:
1. Create your account and verify your driver's license (takes 3 minutes)
2. Choose your vehicle and rental dates
3. Book instantly or request approval from the host
4. Pick up the vehicle at the agreed location
5. Enjoy your trip with 24/7 support available
6. Return the vehicle and share your experience
About.section3GuestProtection:
Protection Included:
Every rental includes comprehensive protection plans with liability coverage up to $1 million. Choose from multiple deductible options to match your comfort level. Roadside assistance is available 24/7 for peace of mind.
About.section3HostLabel: FOR HOSTS - EARN FROM YOUR VEHICLE
About.section3HostList:
List Your Vehicle:
If your car is 2015 or newer with less than 130,000 miles, you can start earning today. Our simple listing process takes just 15 minutes. We'll help you set competitive prices and optimize your listing for maximum bookings.
About.section3HostControl:
You're In Control:
Set your own schedule and prices. Approve or decline rental requests. Choose instant booking for qualified renters or review each request individually. Update your availability calendar anytime through our platform.
About.section3HostEconomics:
Industry-Leading Economics:
Keep 40-90% of your rental earnings based on your insurance tier - the most flexible payout structure in the industry. Payments are deposited within 48-72 hours after each trip. We handle all payment processing and provide tax documentation.
About.section3HostProtection:
Comprehensive Protection:
Your vehicle is protected with physical damage coverage during rentals. Liability insurance up to $1 million is included at no cost to you. Our support team handles any issues that arise, so you can earn passively.
About.section3PartnerCorporate:
Corporate Accounts:
Provide employees with flexible transportation options. Reduce fleet management costs and complexity. Access detailed reporting and centralized billing. Customize policies and approval workflows for your organization.
About.section3PartnerEvent:
Event & Group Rentals:
Planning a conference, wedding, or group trip? We offer multi-vehicle bookings with dedicated support. From SUVs for family reunions to luxury cars for special events, our fleet covers every occasion.
About.section4LocalPhoenix:
Phoenix Born and Raised:
We're not a Silicon Valley startup trying to understand Phoenix from afar. We live here, work here, and understand the unique transportation needs of our desert community. From airport runs to weekend getaways to Sedona, we've got you covered.
About.section4LocalEconomy:
Supporting Local Economy:
Every rental on ItWhip keeps money in our local economy. Hosts are your neighbors - teachers, healthcare workers, small business owners - earning supplemental income. When you choose ItWhip, you're supporting Phoenix families.
About.section4EconomicsGuest:
For Guests:
• 25-40% cheaper than traditional car rental
• No airport facility fees (save 10-15%)
• No hidden charges or surprise fees
• Transparent pricing with everything included
• Free cancellation up to 24 hours before
About.section4EconomicsHost:
For Hosts:
• Highest host earnings in the industry (80-85% revenue share)
• No annual insurance fees (save $2,000-3,000/year)
• Fast payments (48-72 hours)
• Free professional photography for your listing
• Dedicated host success team
About.section4TechSeamless:
Seamless Experience:
Our platform is built on 9 years of enterprise technology experience. Book in 3 minutes, get verified instantly, and manage everything from your phone. Our technology just works, so you can focus on your journey.
About.section4TechArizona:
Arizona-Specific Features:
Our MaxAC™ certification ensures every vehicle is tested for Arizona's extreme heat. Mileage Forensics™ provides complete transparency for every trip. From Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport pickups to Sedona weekend getaways, we've built features specifically for Arizona travelers.
About.section4SafetyVerification:
Comprehensive Verification:
• Government ID verification
• Driving record checks
• Criminal background screening (where permitted)
• Real-time fraud detection
• Two-way rating system
About.section4SafetyCoverage:
Protection Coverage:
• Up to $1 million liability insurance
• Physical damage protection options
• 24/7 roadside assistance
• Emergency support hotline
• Dispute resolution team
About.section4EnvironmentCarbon:
Reducing Carbon Footprint:
Each shared vehicle on our platform eliminates 9-13 private cars from Phoenix roads. This means less traffic, less pollution, and more parking spaces for everyone. In 2024 alone, we've prevented 2,465 tons of CO2 emissions.
About.section4EnvironmentSustainable:
Promoting Sustainable Transportation:
We prioritize electric and hybrid vehicles with premium placement. Currently, 12% of our fleet is electric or hybrid, with a goal to reach 40% by 2027. We're committed to making Phoenix a more sustainable city.
About.section5EconomicFamilies:
Supporting Local Families:
ItWhip has generated over $7.4 million in supplemental income for Arizona families in 2024. Our 725+ hosts earn an average of $850 per month, helping them pay mortgages, save for education, or build emergency funds.
About.section5EconomicOpportunities:
Creating Opportunities:
We've created the equivalent of 340 full-time jobs through our platform. From stay-at-home parents monetizing their second vehicle to retirees supplementing fixed incomes, we're providing flexible earning opportunities for all.
About.section5EconomicBusiness:
Small Business Support:
Local businesses use ItWhip for flexible fleet solutions without the overhead of ownership. Event planners, real estate agents, and contractors access vehicles on-demand, helping them grow without major capital investments.
About.section5SocialAccessibility:
Accessibility Initiatives:
• Student discount program (15% off all rentals)
• Essential worker appreciation rates
• Senior citizen specialized services
• Veteran host priority program
• Payment plans for longer rentals
• No credit check options available
About.section5SocialPartnerships:
Community Partnerships:
• ASU Transportation Partnership - providing affordable options for students
• Phoenix Children's Hospital - family transportation assistance program
• Veteran Employment Initiative - priority onboarding for veteran hosts
• Women in Mobility Scholarship - supporting women entering the mobility sector
About.section5SocialEquity:
Transportation Equity:
We operate in all Phoenix neighborhoods, not just affluent areas. This ensures transportation access for underserved communities where traditional rental companies don't operate. Our varied price points mean there's an option for every budget.
About.section5EnvironmentMeasurable:
Measurable Impact:
• 2,465 tons of CO2 prevented in 2024
• 18,000 gallons of fuel saved monthly
• 4-7 parking spaces freed per shared vehicle
• 15% reduction in vehicle miles traveled
About.section5EnvironmentGreen:
Green Initiatives:
• EV/Hybrid priority placement
• Carbon offset program for all corporate travel
• Paperless operations since inception
• Partnership with local environmental organizations
• Educational content on sustainable transportation
About.section5EnvironmentFuture:
Future Commitments:
By 2030, we aim to be carbon neutral in our operations, have 60% electric/hybrid fleet composition, and eliminate 50 million vehicle miles from Phoenix roads. We're not just building a business - we're building a sustainable future for our city.
About.section6ExpansionGrowing:
Growing Across Arizona:
Following our success in Phoenix, we're expanding to Tucson and Flagstaff in 2025. Our goal is to provide seamless car sharing across the entire state, making it easy to travel anywhere in Arizona without owning a vehicle.
About.section6ExpansionRegional:
Regional Growth:
We're planning expansion to neighboring states including Nevada and New Mexico. Las Vegas, Albuquerque, and Santa Fe are next on our roadmap. By 2027, we aim to be the Southwest's leading car sharing platform.
About.section6FeaturesMobileApps:
Mobile Apps (Q2 2025):
Native iOS and Android apps with biometric authentication, offline mode, push notifications, and digital key technology for contactless pickup. The future of car sharing in your pocket.
About.section6FeaturesSubscription:
Subscription Services (Q4 2025):
Monthly vehicle subscriptions for frequent renters. Flexible alternatives to traditional leases. Perfect for seasonal residents, long-term visitors, or anyone needing regular transportation without ownership.
About.section6FeaturesEnhanced:
Enhanced Integration:
Deeper partnerships with airlines for seamless travel planning. Integration with public transit apps for complete journey planning. Corporate accounts with customized policies and centralized billing.
About.section6InnovationTechnology:
Technology Advancement:
• AI-powered pricing optimization
• Predictive maintenance alerts for hosts
• Augmented reality vehicle inspections
• Blockchain-based identity verification
• Voice-activated booking assistant
About.section6InnovationService:
Service Expansion:
• Luxury and exotic vehicle categories
• Commercial vehicle rentals for businesses
• RV and recreational vehicle sharing
• Specialized vehicles for accessibility needs
• Delivery and logistics solutions
About.section6CommitmentHosts:
To Our Hosts:
We'll continue providing the highest earnings in the industry, improving our technology to make hosting effortless, and supporting you with dedicated success teams. Your success is our success.
About.section6CommitmentGuests:
To Our Guests:
We're committed to maintaining affordable prices, expanding vehicle selection, and ensuring every rental is safe and seamless. Your trust drives us to be better every day.
About.section6CommitmentCommunity:
To Our Community:
We'll keep investing in Phoenix, creating local jobs, supporting local causes, and building sustainable transportation solutions. This is our home, and we're committed to making it better for everyone.
About.section6CommitmentClosing: Join us in revolutionizing transportation in Phoenix and beyond. Whether you're a host, guest, or partner, you're part of something bigger - a movement toward more sustainable, accessible, and community-driven transportation.
About.ctaDescription:
Whether you want to earn from your vehicle, find affordable transportation, or partner with us,
you're joining a movement that's making Arizona more connected and sustainable.
About.contactResponseTime: Response Time: Within 2-4 hours during business hours
About.contactBusinessHours: Business Hours: Monday - Sunday, 7:00 AM - 9:00 PM MST
About.contactLocation: Based in Phoenix, Arizona • Serving communities across the Southwest

HowItWorks.faqDifferenceQuestion: How is ItWhip different from Turo?
HowItWorks.faqDifferenceAnswer: ItWhip is a peer-to-peer car sharing platform focused on Arizona. We offer transparent insurance tiers where YOU choose your earnings (40-90%), $1M liability coverage on all trips, advanced Mileage Forensics™ fraud prevention, and ESG impact tracking. We serve 10+ cities across the Phoenix metro and Tucson areas.
HowItWorks.faqInsuranceAnswer: Every trip includes $1M liability coverage regardless of your tier. Physical damage coverage (collision & comprehensive), roadside assistance, and loss of use compensation are also included. Your tier determines who's primary: BASIC uses platform insurance, STANDARD/PREMIUM use your insurance with platform as backup.
HowItWorks.faqVerificationAnswer: Guests complete a simple 4-step verification: upload driver's license, take a selfie for ID matching, pass automated background/driving record check, and add a payment method. This is a one-time process for all future rentals. Guests who add personal insurance get 50% off security deposits.
HowItWorks.faqPickupAnswer: Multiple convenient options: meet your host at a local spot, pick up at Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport, or request delivery to your address (fees may apply). You'll receive detailed instructions after booking.
HowItWorks.faqCommissionQuestion: How do the commission tiers work?
HowItWorks.faqCommissionAnswer: Your earnings are based on your fleet size: Standard (75%) for 1-9 vehicles, Gold (80%) for 10-49 vehicles, Platinum (85%) for 50-99 vehicles, and Diamond (90%) for 100+ vehicles. All tiers include $1M liability coverage.
HowItWorks.faqEarningsAnswer: Earnings vary by vehicle and tier. At the 90% tier: Economy cars average $800-1,400/month, standard vehicles $1,200-2,000/month, luxury $2,000-4,000/month based on 15-20 rental days. Growing your fleet gets you to higher tiers faster.
HowItWorks.faqPaymentAnswer: Within 48 hours of trip completion via direct deposit - the fastest in the industry. You can track all earnings in real-time through your host dashboard. We also provide automated 1099 tax documentation.
HowItWorks.faqMileageAnswer: Our proprietary system that tracks odometer readings between trips to verify usage patterns, detect potential fraud, and ensure hosts are using vehicles according to their declared usage type. This protects both hosts and insurance partners.
HowItWorks.faqDamageAnswer: Our FNOL (First Notice of Loss) system captures all information insurers need. Report damage within 24 hours through the app with photos. Claims are typically resolved within 48-72 hours. Your deductible depends on your tier: BASIC $2,500, STANDARD $1,500, PREMIUM $1,000.
HowItWorks.faqExpansionAnswer: Currently, we're focused on the Phoenix metro area and Arizona. We operate under Arizona's P2P car sharing legislation (A.R.S. § 28-9601). Expansion to other states is planned for 2026.

SearchResults.costToRent: How much does it cost to rent a car in Phoenix?
SearchResults.costToRentAnswer: Car rentals from local owners in Phoenix start at $59/day for economy cars. Luxury vehicles and SUVs typically range from $99-$299/day. Weekly and monthly rentals include discounts of 15-30%.
SearchResults.airportDelivery: Can I get airport delivery for my rental car?
SearchResults.airportDeliveryAnswer: Yes! Many of our local hosts offer free or low-cost delivery to Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport (PHX). You can filter search results to show only cars with airport pickup available.
SearchResults.insuranceIncluded: Is insurance included with peer-to-peer car rentals?
SearchResults.insuranceIncludedAnswer: All rentals through ItWhip include liability insurance. Comprehensive coverage is available as an add-on for $15-25/day, covering collision damage and theft protection.
SearchResults.minimumAge: What is the minimum age to rent a car?
SearchResults.minimumAgeAnswer: The minimum age to rent is 21 years old with a valid driver's license. Renters under 25 may have additional requirements depending on the vehicle type.
SearchResults.instantBookingAnswer: Cars marked with "Instant Book" can be reserved immediately without waiting for host approval. Your booking is confirmed as soon as you complete payment.
SearchResults.costQuestion: How much does it cost to rent a car?
SearchResults.airportAnswer: Yes! Many hosts offer free delivery to Phoenix Sky Harbor (PHX).
SearchResults.insuranceAnswer: All rentals include $1M liability coverage. Comprehensive coverage available.

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.subtitle: Everything you need to know about peer-to-peer car sharing with ItWhip in Arizona.
FAQ.browseCarsFromOwners: Browse cars from local Phoenix owners
FAQ.listCarKeep90: List your car and keep up to 90%
FAQ.teamHereToHelp: Our team is here to help you get started
FAQ.aWhatIsP2P: Peer-to-peer (P2P) car rental is a car sharing model where private vehicle owners rent their personal cars directly to other people through a platform like ItWhip. Unlike traditional rental companies that own fleets, P2P connects local car owners with renters—offering more variety, better prices, and a personal touch. Think of it as Airbnb for cars.
FAQ.qItwhipVsTuro: How is ItWhip different from Turo?
FAQ.aItwhipVsTuro: ItWhip offers several advantages over Turo for Arizona hosts and guests: (1) Higher earnings—hosts keep up to 90% vs Turo's 60-85%, (2) Faster payments—48 hours vs 3-5 days, (3) Higher coverage—$1M liability vs $750K, (4) Mileage Forensics™—GPS-verified trip tracking Turo doesn't offer, (5) ESG Dashboard—environmental impact tracking, and (6) Arizona-focused—we know the local market, events, and compliance requirements.
FAQ.aOutsideArizona: Currently, ItWhip operates exclusively in Arizona, serving the Phoenix metro area including Scottsdale, Tempe, Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, and Glendale. We're focused on delivering the best P2P car sharing experience in Arizona before expanding. Expansion to additional states is planned for 2026.
FAQ.qLegalArizona: Is peer-to-peer car rental legal in Arizona?
FAQ.aLegalArizona: Yes, absolutely. Arizona has specific legislation governing P2P car sharing: A.R.S. § 28-9601 through 28-9613. This law establishes clear rules for platforms, hosts, and guests—including insurance requirements, liability protections, and tax obligations. ItWhip is fully compliant with all Arizona P2P car sharing regulations, and we handle Transaction Privilege Tax (TPT) collection and remittance on your behalf.
FAQ.qWhatNeedToRent: What do I need to rent a car on ItWhip?
FAQ.aWhatNeedToRent: To rent on ItWhip, you need: (1) A valid driver's license (US or international), (2) Be at least 21 years old (25+ for luxury/exotic vehicles), (3) A valid credit or debit card, and (4) Pass our verification process including a background check and driving record review. The verification is quick—most guests are approved within minutes and it's a one-time process for all future rentals.
FAQ.qGuestInsurance: How does insurance work when I rent?
FAQ.aGuestInsurance: Every ItWhip rental includes $1M liability coverage automatically—no extra purchase required. This protects you if you cause injury or property damage to others. For damage to the rental vehicle itself, you're covered under the host's protection plan with deductibles ranging from $1,000-$2,500 depending on their tier. You can also add your own personal auto insurance to get 50% off the security deposit.
FAQ.aPickupOptions: ItWhip offers flexible pickup options: (1) Hotel delivery—free delivery to your accommodation, (2) Airport pickup—convenient locations near Phoenix Sky Harbor (PHX), (3) Home delivery—have the car delivered to your address (fees may apply), or (4) Host meetup—meet the host at a mutually agreed location. You'll receive detailed pickup instructions after booking.
FAQ.qAgeRequirement: How old do I have to be to rent?
FAQ.aAgeRequirement: The minimum age to rent on ItWhip is 21 years old. For luxury, exotic, and high-performance vehicles, you must be at least 25 years old. All renters must have a valid driver's license and pass our verification process regardless of age.
FAQ.qPersonalInsurance: Can I add my own insurance for a discount?
FAQ.aPersonalInsurance: Yes! Guests who verify their personal auto insurance through ItWhip receive a 50% discount on security deposits. Your personal insurance becomes tertiary coverage (after the host's insurance and platform insurance), but the real benefit is the reduced upfront cost. Simply upload your insurance card during verification to unlock the discount on all future rentals.
FAQ.qHowMuchEarn: How much can I earn renting my car?
FAQ.aHowMuchEarn: Host earnings depend on your vehicle type, rental frequency, and insurance tier. At the 90% tier: Economy cars average $800-1,400/month, standard vehicles $1,200-2,000/month, and luxury vehicles $2,000-4,000/month—based on 15-20 rental days. Phoenix hosts benefit from year-round demand, especially during major events like Barrett-Jackson, Spring Training, and the Waste Management Open.
FAQ.qInsuranceTiers: How do the insurance tiers work (40/75/90%)?
FAQ.aInsuranceTiers: Your earnings tier is determined by the insurance YOU bring: BASIC (40%)—you bring no insurance, we provide full platform coverage, best for new hosts getting started. STANDARD (75%)—you bring P2P insurance (like State Farm or Getaround coverage), your insurance is primary. PREMIUM (90%)—you bring commercial auto insurance, maximum earnings with lowest deductibles. All tiers include $1M liability coverage.
FAQ.aWhenPaid: ItWhip pays hosts within 48 hours of trip completion—the fastest in the industry. Payments go directly to your bank account via direct deposit (Stripe Connect). You can track all earnings, pending payments, and completed payouts in real-time through your host dashboard. We also provide automated 1099 tax documentation at year-end.
FAQ.aMileageForensics: Mileage Forensics™ is ItWhip's proprietary system that tracks and verifies odometer readings between trips. It detects gaps in mileage that might indicate unreported personal use, fraud, or unauthorized trips. For hosts, this means complete transparency on how your vehicle is used. For insurers, it provides verified usage data for accurate underwriting. No other P2P platform offers this level of trip verification.
FAQ.aVehicleRequirements: To list on ItWhip, your vehicle must: (1) Be model year 2015 or newer, (2) Have under 130,000 miles, (3) Have a clean title (no salvage or rebuilt titles), (4) Pass a safety inspection, (5) Be registered and located in the Phoenix metro area, and (6) Have valid registration and be in good mechanical condition. Luxury, exotic, and specialty vehicles are welcome!
FAQ.qWorthIt: Is renting out my car worth it?
FAQ.aWorthIt: For most Arizona hosts, yes. Consider: The average ItWhip host earns $800-2,000/month with just 15-20 rental days. That could cover your entire car payment plus insurance. You also get tax benefits—vehicle depreciation, maintenance, and insurance are potentially deductible. Plus, with ItWhip's 90% tier, you keep more than any other platform. The math usually works in your favor, especially for vehicles that sit unused during work hours.
FAQ.aCoverageIncluded: Every ItWhip trip includes: (1) $1,000,000 liability coverage—protects against third-party injury and property damage claims, (2) Comprehensive coverage—theft, vandalism, weather damage, (3) Collision coverage—damage from accidents, (4) 24/7 roadside assistance—towing, flat tires, lockouts, jump starts, and (5) Loss of use compensation—hosts receive daily payments if their car is being repaired after an incident.
FAQ.qAccidentProcess: What happens if there's an accident?
FAQ.aAccidentProcess: If there's an accident: (1) Ensure everyone is safe and call 911 if needed, (2) Document the scene with photos and get a police report, (3) Report the incident through the ItWhip app within 24 hours, (4) Our claims team guides you through the FNOL (First Notice of Loss) process, and (5) Claims are typically resolved within 48-72 hours. Both hosts and guests are protected under our coverage—your personal auto insurance is not affected for covered claims.
FAQ.aDeductibles: Deductibles vary by host tier: BASIC tier (40% earnings)—$2,500 deductible, STANDARD tier (75% earnings)—$1,500 deductible, PREMIUM tier (90% earnings)—$1,000 deductible. Higher tiers not only earn more but also have lower out-of-pocket costs if something goes wrong. Guests are responsible for deductibles for damage they cause, up to the security deposit amount.
FAQ.qEsgScore: What is the ESG Impact Score?
FAQ.aEsgScore: The ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) Impact Score measures each vehicle's environmental footprint and the host's sustainability practices. It factors in: fuel efficiency, emissions category, maintenance compliance, and trip patterns. Guests can filter by ESG score to choose eco-friendly rentals. Hosts with high ESG scores earn badges and may attract environmentally-conscious guests willing to pay premium rates. This is part of ItWhip's commitment to CSRD-compliant sustainability tracking.
FAQ.aMaxAC: MaxAC™ is ItWhip's Arizona-specific certification ensuring vehicles perform in extreme desert heat. Every MaxAC™ certified vehicle has: (1) Verified working A/C tested above 100°F, (2) Proper window tinting within legal limits, (3) Maintained cooling system, and (4) Interior sun protection. In Phoenix summers, this matters. Guests never have to worry about getting into a hot car from a rental lot—MaxAC™ cars arrive cool and comfortable.

RentalsBudget.faq0Question: How can I find cheap car rentals in Phoenix?
RentalsBudget.faq0Answer: ItWhip offers {carCount}+ budget-friendly cars starting at just ${minPrice}/day. Our <howItWorksLink>peer-to-peer model</howItWorksLink> means you rent directly from local owners, saving up to 35% compared to traditional rental companies. All rentals include <insuranceLink>$1M liability coverage</insuranceLink> with no hidden fees.
RentalsBudget.faq1Question: Can I rent a car for Uber or Lyft in Phoenix?
RentalsBudget.faq1Answer: Yes! Many of our budget cars are <rideshareLink>rideshare-approved</rideshareLink> for Uber, Lyft, and other gig platforms. Look for the orange "Rideshare" badge when <rentalsLink>browsing cars</rentalsLink>. These vehicles meet all rideshare requirements and come with the insurance coverage you need to drive for gig apps.
RentalsBudget.faq2Question: What's the cheapest rideshare rental for Uber drivers?
RentalsBudget.faq2Answer: Budget <rideshareLink>rideshare rentals</rideshareLink> on ItWhip start from ${minPrice}/day. We have rideshare-approved vehicles perfect for Uber, Lyft, DoorDash, Instacart, Amazon Flex, and other delivery apps. <weeklyLink>Weekly</weeklyLink> and monthly discounts available for gig economy drivers.
RentalsBudget.faq3Question: Are budget car rentals on ItWhip safe?
RentalsBudget.faq3Answer: Absolutely! Every rental includes <insuranceLink>$1M liability insurance</insuranceLink>. All hosts and vehicles are verified through our <howItWorksLink>verification process</howItWorksLink>, and we maintain strict safety standards. You get the same <protectionLink>protection</protectionLink> as premium rentals at a fraction of the cost.
RentalsBudget.faq4Question: Can I use a rental car for Amazon Flex or DoorDash?
RentalsBudget.faq4Answer: Yes! Our budget rentals are perfect for delivery drivers. Whether you drive for Amazon Flex, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Instacart, or Grubhub, our affordable rates help you maximize your earnings. Check out our <rideshareLink>rideshare-approved vehicles</rideshareLink> for the best fit.
RentalsBudget.faq5Question: What do I need to rent a car for rideshare or delivery?
RentalsBudget.faq5Answer: To rent on ItWhip, you need: a valid driver's license, to be 21+ years old, a clean driving record, and a valid payment method. See our full <howItWorksLink>requirements</howItWorksLink>. For rideshare apps like Uber and Lyft, you'll also need to meet their specific driver requirements.
RentalsBudget.faq6Question: Why are ItWhip rentals cheaper than Hertz or Enterprise?
RentalsBudget.faq6Answer: ItWhip is a <howItWorksLink>peer-to-peer platform</howItWorksLink> where you rent directly from local car owners. Without expensive rental lots and corporate overhead, owners can offer competitive rates. Perfect for gig workers who need affordable wheels to earn!
RentalsBudget.faq7Question: Do you offer weekly rates for rideshare drivers?
RentalsBudget.faq7Answer: Yes! Many hosts offer significant discounts for <weeklyLink>weekly</weeklyLink> and monthly rentals — ideal for full-time Uber, Lyft, and delivery drivers. Browse our <rentalsLink>available cars</rentalsLink> and contact hosts directly to negotiate the best rates for longer rentals.

Contact.formUrgentNote: For urgent safety issues during an active ride, call us at (855) 703-0806 or the 24/7 roadside line at (602) 609-2577. You can also submit the form below and we'll follow up.
Contact.locationsDisclaimer: Our offices are operations centers without walk-in reception. For support, call (855) 703-0806 or use the contact form above.
Contact.faqQ1: What's the fastest way to reach support?
Contact.faqA1: Call us at (855) 703-0806 — we're available Monday through Sunday, 7 AM to 9 PM MST. For roadside emergencies during an active rental, call (602) 609-2577 anytime, 24/7. You can also use the contact form above and we'll respond within 2–4 hours.
Contact.faqQ2: How quickly will I receive a response?
Contact.faqA2: Phone calls are answered right away during business hours. Form and email responses vary by inquiry type: Urgent ride issues (1-2 hours), General questions (24 hours), Partnership inquiries (24-48 hours).
Contact.faqQ3: What if I have an emergency during a ride?
Contact.faqA3: For true emergencies, always call 911 first. Then call our 24/7 roadside line at (602) 609-2577 for vehicle assistance, or (855) 703-0806 for general support.
Contact.faqQ4: Can I visit your office locations?
Contact.faqA4: Our offices are technology and operations centers without walk-in reception. The best way to reach us is by phone at (855) 703-0806 or through the contact form.

InsuranceGuide.heroSubtitle: Everything you need to know about protection on ItWhip, explained in plain English.
InsuranceGuide.overviewSubtitle: We've built a transparent insurance system that puts you in control.
InsuranceGuide.overviewSimpleText1: When you list your car on ItWhip, you choose an insurance tier based on what coverage you bring to the table. The more insurance you provide, the more you earn from each rental.
InsuranceGuide.overviewSimpleText2: Think of it like this: If we're handling all the insurance risk, we need a bigger cut to cover potential claims. But if you already have commercial insurance that covers rentals, we're sharing less risk—so you keep more money.
InsuranceGuide.tierSystemDesc: 3 simple tiers based on the insurance you bring: 40%, 75%, or 90% earnings.
InsuranceGuide.primarySecondaryDesc: Your insurance is primary when you bring it. Platform insurance backs you up.
InsuranceGuide.alwaysCoveredDesc: No matter your tier, every rental includes $1M liability coverage.
InsuranceGuide.tiersSubtitle: Your earnings are determined by the insurance you bring. It's that simple.
InsuranceGuide.basicTierBestFor: Best for: New hosts, occasional renters, or those without P2P-friendly insurance.
InsuranceGuide.standardTierBestFor: Best for: Hosts with Getaround, State Farm P2P, or similar coverage.
InsuranceGuide.premiumTierBestFor: Best for: Fleet operators, serious hosts, and those with commercial policies.
InsuranceGuide.earningsNote: * Based on $100/day rate with 15 rental days per month
InsuranceGuide.primarySecondarySubtitle: Understanding which insurance pays first is crucial. Here's how it works.
InsuranceGuide.whatIsPrimaryText1: Primary insurance is the coverage that pays first when there's a claim. It's the "first responder" of insurance—the policy that steps up immediately.
InsuranceGuide.whatIsPrimaryText2: Secondary insurance only kicks in after the primary coverage is exhausted or doesn't apply. Think of it as your backup safety net.
InsuranceGuide.basicTierExplain: We handle everything. Our insurance is the first (and only) coverage that applies during rentals.
InsuranceGuide.standardTierExplain: Your P2P policy pays first. If it doesn't cover something or denies the claim, our platform insurance backs you up.
InsuranceGuide.premiumTierExplain: Your commercial policy handles claims first. We provide backup coverage if needed.
InsuranceGuide.hierarchyText: When a claim is filed, here's the order in which insurance coverage is applied:
InsuranceGuide.hierarchyStep1Desc: Host's verified insurance (P2P or Commercial) OR Platform insurance if host has none
InsuranceGuide.hierarchyStep2Desc: Platform insurance (backup if primary denies or doesn't cover)
InsuranceGuide.hierarchyStep3Desc: Guest's personal insurance (if they added and verified it)
InsuranceGuide.bringYourOwnSubtitle: How to qualify for the 75% or 90% tier by adding your own coverage.
InsuranceGuide.processStep1Text: Not all insurance covers car sharing. You need either:
InsuranceGuide.processStep1Option1: P2P Insurance - Policies from providers like State Farm, Farmers, or specialty P2P insurers
InsuranceGuide.processStep1Option2: Commercial Auto Insurance - A policy that explicitly covers rental/livery use
InsuranceGuide.processStep2Text: In your host dashboard, upload your insurance declaration page showing coverage limits, policy number, expiration date, and named insured.
InsuranceGuide.processStep3Text: Our team reviews your policy to confirm it covers P2P rentals or commercial use. This usually takes 1-2 business days.
InsuranceGuide.processStep4Text: Once approved, your earnings tier automatically upgrades. You'll see the change in your dashboard immediately.
InsuranceGuide.tier75Providers: State Farm (P2P endorsement), Farmers (rideshare/P2P coverage), USAA (car sharing endorsement), Allstate (peer economy endorsement), Liberty Mutual (livery coverage), Specialty P2P insurers
InsuranceGuide.tier90RequirementsList: Commercial auto policy, Covers rental/livery use explicitly, Named insured matches vehicle registration, Active and valid through rental periods
InsuranceGuide.tier90Minimum: Minimum Coverage: $500K/$1M liability, full comprehensive & collision, garage keeper's liability
InsuranceGuide.personalPolicyWarningText: Most standard personal auto insurance policies do not cover car sharing. In fact, renting your car without proper coverage can void your personal policy entirely. Always check with your insurance provider or get a specific P2P/commercial endorsement.
InsuranceGuide.coverageSubtitle: Complete breakdown of protection during rentals.
InsuranceGuide.deductiblesSubtitle: Your deductible is the amount you pay before coverage kicks in.
InsuranceGuide.deductibleExplain: Think of a deductible as your "skin in the game." If there's $3,000 in damage and you have a $1,500 deductible, you pay the first $1,500 and insurance covers the remaining $1,500.
InsuranceGuide.whyLowerDeductibles: Why do higher tiers have lower deductibles?
InsuranceGuide.whyLowerDeductiblesAnswer: Because you're bringing more insurance to the table. When you have commercial insurance (90% tier), your insurer has already assessed you as a lower risk—so we can offer you a lower deductible.
InsuranceGuide.tierComparisonTitle: 40% Tier vs Bringing Your Own Insurance
InsuranceGuide.tierComparisonBasic: 40% Tier (BASIC): You don't need any insurance. We provide everything. But you keep less of each rental AND have a higher deductible ($2,500) if something goes wrong.
InsuranceGuide.tierComparisonTiers: 75%/90% Tier (STANDARD/PREMIUM): You bring your own coverage. You keep more money AND have lower deductibles ($1,500 or $1,000). Plus, your insurance likely has better service and faster claims because it's your policy.
InsuranceGuide.tierComparisonConclusion: Bottom Line: If you're serious about hosting and plan to rent frequently, getting P2P or commercial insurance almost always pays for itself through higher earnings and lower deductibles.
InsuranceGuide.fnolSubtitle: How we handle incidents from first report to resolution.
InsuranceGuide.whatIsFnolText1: FNOL (First Notice of Loss) is the insurance industry term for the initial report you make when an incident occurs. It's the official start of the claims process.
InsuranceGuide.whatIsFnolText2: On ItWhip, we've built an FNOL-ready system that captures all the information insurance carriers need right from the start. This means faster claims processing and fewer back-and-forth requests.
InsuranceGuide.timelineStep1Desc: Guest or host reports incident through the app. Photos, location, and description are captured automatically.
InsuranceGuide.timelineStep2Desc: Our team reviews the claim, verifies coverage, and contacts all parties. We gather additional documentation if needed.
InsuranceGuide.timelineStep3Desc: FDCR (Full Documentation & Claims Report) is compiled with trip data, mileage forensics, photos, and guest/host statements.
InsuranceGuide.timelineStep4Desc: Claim approved/denied, repair estimates provided, and payout processed. For complex claims, this may extend to 5-7 days.
InsuranceGuide.lapseTitle: What Happens If Your Insurance Lapses?
InsuranceGuide.lapseSubtitle: Important information for hosts in the 75% and 90% tiers.
InsuranceGuide.lapseSeriousText: If you're in the 75% or 90% tier and your insurance expires, lapses, or is cancelled—you're no longer eligible for that tier. Here's what happens:
InsuranceGuide.ifLapsesStep1Desc: You'll automatically drop to the 40% BASIC tier until you provide valid insurance again.
InsuranceGuide.ifLapsesStep2Desc: Any claims during the lapse period will be subject to the $2,500 BASIC deductible, not your previous lower amount.
InsuranceGuide.ifLapsesStep3Desc: All rentals during the lapse earn at the 40% rate, not your previous tier rate. This applies to any trips that start during the lapse.
InsuranceGuide.ifLapsesStep4Desc: For extended lapses (30+ days), your vehicle listing may be temporarily paused until insurance is restored.
InsuranceGuide.howToAvoidPoint1: Set calendar reminders for renewal dates
InsuranceGuide.howToAvoidPoint2: Enable auto-pay with your insurance carrier
InsuranceGuide.howToAvoidPoint3: Update your ItWhip profile when you renew
InsuranceGuide.howToAvoidPoint4: Keep digital copies of your documents ready
InsuranceGuide.howToRestorePoint1: Get your insurance reinstated or renewed
InsuranceGuide.howToRestorePoint2: Upload new declaration page to your profile
InsuranceGuide.howToRestorePoint5: Future rentals earn at your proper rate
InsuranceGuide.trackingText: Our system monitors your insurance expiration dates. You'll receive reminders at 60 days, 30 days, 14 days, and 7 days before expiration. We want you to stay in your highest earning tier—it's better for everyone.
InsuranceGuide.guestSubtitle: What renters need to know about protection during trips.
InsuranceGuide.guestAlreadyCoveredText: Every rental on ItWhip includes $1M liability coverage. As a guest, you don't need to bring your own insurance to rent—but you can add it for extra benefits.
InsuranceGuide.howGuestsAddStep1: 1. Go to your guest profile settings
InsuranceGuide.howGuestsAddStep2: 2. Upload your personal auto insurance declaration page
InsuranceGuide.howGuestsAddStep3: 3. Our team verifies it covers rental vehicles
InsuranceGuide.howGuestsAddStep4: 4. Once approved, you get 50% off all future deposits
InsuranceGuide.howGuestsAddNote: Note: Your personal insurance must explicitly cover rental vehicles. Many policies exclude P2P rentals—check with your carrier first.
InsuranceGuide.faqQ1: Do I need my own car insurance to host on ItWhip?
InsuranceGuide.faqA1: No. With the BASIC tier (40%), we provide all the insurance coverage. You don't need any of your own. However, if you want to earn more (75% or 90%), you'll need to bring P2P or commercial insurance that covers car sharing.
InsuranceGuide.faqQ2: Will my personal auto insurance cover me while renting on ItWhip?
InsuranceGuide.faqA2: Almost certainly not. Most personal auto policies explicitly exclude coverage when you're renting your car for money. Using your personal policy for car sharing could actually void your coverage entirely. We strongly recommend either staying in the BASIC tier or getting proper P2P/commercial coverage.
InsuranceGuide.faqQ3: What's the difference between P2P insurance and commercial insurance?
InsuranceGuide.faqA3Part1: P2P Insurance: An endorsement or separate policy specifically designed for peer-to-peer car sharing. Offered by some major insurers like State Farm, Farmers, and specialty providers. Usually more affordable than commercial. Qualifies you for the 75% tier.
InsuranceGuide.faqA3Part2: Commercial Insurance: A full commercial auto policy that covers business use of your vehicle, including rentals. More expensive but comprehensive. Required for the 90% tier. Best for fleet operators or those with multiple vehicles.
InsuranceGuide.faqQ4: What happens during a claim if I have my own insurance?
InsuranceGuide.faqA4Step1: If you're in the 75% or 90% tier with your own insurance:
InsuranceGuide.faqA4Step2: 1. Your insurance is primary - we file the claim with your carrier first
InsuranceGuide.faqA4Step3: 2. You pay your policy's deductible (not ours)
InsuranceGuide.faqA4Step4: 3. If your insurer denies or doesn't fully cover the claim, our platform insurance kicks in as secondary
InsuranceGuide.faqA4Step5: 4. You then pay our tier deductible ($1,500 or $1,000) for any remaining amount
InsuranceGuide.faqA4Conclusion: This layered approach means you're never left without coverage.
InsuranceGuide.faqQ5: How long does the claims process take?
InsuranceGuide.faqA5: Our target timeline: Incident Report (FNOL): Immediate upon submission, Initial Review: Within 24 hours, FDCR Documentation: 24-48 hours, Standard Resolution: 48-72 hours, Complex Claims: 5-7 business days. Most straightforward claims (minor damage, clear fault) are resolved within 3 business days.
InsuranceGuide.faqQ6: Can I switch tiers at any time?
InsuranceGuide.faqA6: Yes, but changes only apply to future rentals, not current bookings. To upgrade your tier, simply upload your new insurance documents and wait for fleet verification (1-2 business days). To downgrade, you can update your settings anytime—but remember you'll earn less and have a higher deductible.
InsuranceGuide.faqQ7: What is Mileage Forensics and how does it affect insurance?
InsuranceGuide.faqA7Part1: Mileage Forensics™ is our system that tracks odometer readings between trips to verify usage patterns. It helps with insurance by:
InsuranceGuide.faqA7Point1: Detecting potential fraud (like unreported personal use)
InsuranceGuide.faqA7Point3: Verifying hosts are using vehicles according to their declared usage type
InsuranceGuide.faqA7Point4: Giving insurance carriers confidence in our data
InsuranceGuide.faqA7Conclusion: This is part of why we can offer competitive coverage—we have the data to back up claims accurately.
InsuranceGuide.faqQ8: Does coverage apply if the guest drives outside Arizona?
InsuranceGuide.faqA8: Coverage applies anywhere in the continental United States. However, trips to Mexico require advance approval and additional coverage. Trips to Canada are covered but require notification. Any international travel outside these areas is not covered.
InsuranceGuide.faqQ9: What if I have a claim and my insurance lapses during the process?
InsuranceGuide.faqA9: Claims are evaluated based on your tier status at the time of the incident, not when the claim is resolved. If you had valid 75% or 90% tier insurance when the incident occurred, that coverage applies to the claim—even if your insurance later lapses. However, any new rentals would be at the 40% tier until insurance is restored.
InsuranceGuide.faqQ10: Are luxury and exotic cars covered differently?
InsuranceGuide.faqA10Part1: Yes, high-value vehicles ($75K+) have additional requirements:
InsuranceGuide.faqA10Point1: Enhanced guest verification (higher age minimum, credit check)
InsuranceGuide.faqA10Conclusion: Coverage limits are the same, but we take extra precautions to protect valuable vehicles.
InsuranceGuide.ctaSubtitle: Choose your tier and start earning with confidence.
InsuranceGuide.legalText: Protection provided through licensed third-party insurance carriers. Coverage amounts and availability subject to vehicle eligibility, location, and underwriter approval. ItWhip facilitates coverage but is not an insurance company. Protection applies only during active rental periods booked through our platform. Physical damage reimbursement is contractual allocation of risk, not insurance. Deductibles and coverage limits are subject to change. Individual insurance requirements and coverage may vary. Consult with your personal insurance provider before participating in car sharing. FNOL and claims processes are subject to documentation requirements and may vary based on incident complexity. Insurance tier eligibility requires fleet verification of provided documentation. Lapsed insurance results in automatic tier downgrade. Platform reserves right to modify terms, features, and tier requirements with notice. Arizona-specific regulations apply. This information does not constitute insurance, legal, or financial advice.
InsuranceGuide.integrationMileageDesc: Claims are backed by GPS-verified trip data for faster resolution and accurate documentation.
InsuranceGuide.integrationEsgDesc: Your compliance history contributes to your ESG score, building trust with guests and insurers.
InsuranceGuide.ctaSubtitleFull: Choose your tier and start earning with confidence in Phoenix, Scottsdale, and Tempe.
