Support.faqAnswer7Before: A security deposit hold is placed on your card at booking. The amount depends on the vehicle type and your insurance coverage. Deposits are released after a clean return. Learn more about
Support.faqAnswerText8: Yes! Every ItWhip rental includes 24/7 roadside assistance. Call (602) 609-2577 for flat tires, dead batteries, lockouts, fuel delivery, and towing.
Support.faqAnswer8Before: Yes! Every ItWhip rental includes 24/7 roadside assistance. Call (602) 609-2577 for flat tires, dead batteries, lockouts, fuel delivery, and towing.
Support.supportAvailable: Our support team is available 24/7 to help with any questions or concerns.

SupportBooking.title: How to Book a Car
SupportBooking.subtitle: Step-by-step guide to renting on ItWhip
SupportBooking.stepDescription1: Enter your location, dates, and times on the homepage or rentals page. Use filters to narrow down by vehicle type, price range, or features. You can also use Choé AI for a conversational search experience.
SupportBooking.stepDescription2: Browse available cars and compare options. Check photos, reviews, features, and pricing. Each listing shows the daily rate, insurance options, and host details.
SupportBooking.stepDescription3: Pick your preferred pickup and return dates and times. Longer rentals often come with discounted daily rates. Make sure the times work with the host's availability.
SupportBooking.stepDescription4: Add your payment method and choose your insurance coverage level. Review the price breakdown including taxes, fees, and security deposit. Confirm your booking to lock in the reservation.
SupportBooking.stepDescription5: You'll receive a booking confirmation with all the details. Coordinate pickup location and time with your host through the app. Complete the vehicle inspection checklist at pickup.

SupportClaims.title: File a Claim
SupportClaims.subtitle: How to file an insurance claim for damage, theft, or accidents
SupportClaims.stepDescription1: Take clear photos and videos of all damage from multiple angles. Include close-ups and wide shots showing the full extent. Timestamp your photos if possible.
SupportClaims.stepDescription2: Call our 24/7 support line at (855) 703-0806 or file a claim through your dashboard. Report the incident as soon as possible — ideally within 24 hours.
SupportClaims.stepDescription3: Fill out the claim form in your dashboard with all incident details. Upload your photos, police report (if applicable), and any witness information.
SupportClaims.stepDescription4: Our claims team will review your submission within 2-3 business days. You'll receive updates via email and can track the status in your dashboard.
SupportClaims.whatToIncludeTitle: What to Include in Your Claim
SupportClaims.claimInclude1: Clear photos of all damage (multiple angles)
SupportClaims.claimInclude2: Date, time, and location of the incident
SupportClaims.claimInclude5: Contact info for any other parties involved

SupportCleaningPolicy.heroSubtitle: Understand our cleaning standards and what to expect when returning your rental vehicle.
SupportCleaningPolicy.goldenRuleText: Return the vehicle in the same condition you received it. A quick clean-up before return goes a long way and helps you avoid any cleaning fees.
SupportCleaningPolicy.doItem1: Remove all personal belongings and trash
SupportCleaningPolicy.doItem2: Wipe down the dashboard and surfaces
SupportCleaningPolicy.doItem3: Vacuum or shake out floor mats
SupportCleaningPolicy.doItem4: Return the fuel level as agreed
SupportCleaningPolicy.doItem5: Report any spills or stains immediately
SupportCleaningPolicy.doItem6: Take photos of the interior before return
SupportCleaningPolicy.doItem7: Dispose of any food wrappers or bottles
SupportCleaningPolicy.dontItem1: Smoke or vape in the vehicle (strict policy)
SupportCleaningPolicy.dontItem2: Leave pet hair or pet waste in the car
SupportCleaningPolicy.dontItem3: Spill food or drinks and leave them unaddressed
SupportCleaningPolicy.dontItem4: Leave strong odors (perfume, air fresheners, etc.)
SupportCleaningPolicy.dontItem5: Stain or damage upholstery or carpets
SupportCleaningPolicy.dontItem6: Leave mud, sand, or excessive dirt
SupportCleaningPolicy.dontItem7: Return with overflowing trash or debris
SupportCleaningPolicy.noSmokingDesc: All ItWhip vehicles are strictly non-smoking. This includes cigarettes, cigars, vapes, and e-cigarettes. Any evidence of smoking will result in a cleaning fee.
SupportCleaningPolicy.noSmokingFee: Smoking fee: $150 - $250 (includes deep interior cleaning and odor removal)
SupportCleaningPolicy.petPolicyDesc: Pets are allowed in some vehicles with host approval. Always use a pet carrier or seat cover. Excessive pet hair or damage will incur a cleaning fee.
SupportCleaningPolicy.foodDrinksDesc: Be careful with food and drinks in the vehicle. Clean up any spills immediately. Stains from food or beverages may incur cleaning charges.
SupportCleaningPolicy.foodDrinksFee: Spill cleaning fee: $25 - $100 (depends on stain type and severity)
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeDesc1: Quick interior tidying needed beyond normal wear
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeDesc2: Interior detailing required to restore condition
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeDisclaimer: Fees are assessed based on photo evidence taken at return. All fees are subject to review and you may dispute any charges within 48 hours.
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeIntro: If you believe a cleaning fee was charged unfairly, you can dispute it through the following process:
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeStep1: Review the charge details and photos in your dashboard
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeStep2: Submit a dispute with your own photos taken at drop-off
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeStep3: Our team will review both sets of evidence within 48 hours
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeStep4: You'll be notified of the outcome via email
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeStep5: If the dispute is upheld, the fee will be refunded to your payment method
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqQuestion1: Will I be charged if the car was already dirty when I picked it up?
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer1: No. Document the condition with photos at pickup using the trip start checklist. Any pre-existing conditions noted at pickup will not be charged to you at return.
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqQuestion2: How long do I have to dispute a cleaning fee?
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer2: You have 48 hours from when the fee is posted to submit a dispute through your dashboard. Make sure to include any photos you took at drop-off.
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqQuestion3: Can I clean the car myself to avoid fees?
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer3: Absolutely! We recommend doing a quick clean-up before returning. Remove trash, wipe surfaces, and shake out floor mats. This simple effort usually prevents any cleaning charges.
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqQuestion4: What if the host agreed to allow pets?
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer4: Even with host approval for pets, you are still responsible for cleaning up pet hair and any mess. Use a seat cover or blanket to protect the upholstery.
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer5: Please avoid using strong air fresheners, as they can leave lingering odors that require professional cleaning to remove. A neutral-smelling interior is preferred.
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqQuestion6: What counts as 'normal wear and tear'?
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer6: Normal wear includes light dust, minor footprints on floor mats, and typical usage marks. It does not include stains, spills, trash, odors, or any condition that requires extra cleaning.
SupportCleaningPolicy.proTip1Desc: Keep a small bag in the car for any wrappers, receipts, or trash during your trip.
SupportCleaningPolicy.proTip2Desc: Always secure drinks in cup holders and use lids to prevent spills.
SupportCleaningPolicy.proTip3Desc: Cover seats with a blanket or towel if traveling with pets.
SupportCleaningPolicy.proTip4Desc: Keep a pack of wipes in the glove box for quick clean-ups before return.
SupportCleaningPolicy.ctaSubtitle: Our support team can help review any charges or answer questions about our cleaning policy.

SupportDamageProcess.heroSubtitle: Step-by-step guide to reporting and resolving vehicle damage. We make it fair and transparent for everyone.
SupportDamageProcess.preventionDesc: Always complete the pre-trip inspection checklist and take photos before driving. This protects you from being held responsible for pre-existing damage.
SupportDamageProcess.step1Desc: Take clear photos and videos of all damage immediately. The more evidence you provide, the smoother the process will be.
SupportDamageProcess.step1Tip1: Multiple angles of each damaged area
SupportDamageProcess.step1Tip2: Wide shots showing full vehicle context
SupportDamageProcess.step1Tip3: Close-ups of scratches, dents, or marks
SupportDamageProcess.step1Tip4: Photos of any other vehicles involved
SupportDamageProcess.step2Desc: Contact ItWhip support immediately. Early reporting helps ensure a fair resolution and faster processing.
SupportDamageProcess.step2Tip2: File a report through your dashboard
SupportDamageProcess.step2Tip3: Include all relevant details and timeline
SupportDamageProcess.step2Tip4: Note any witnesses or other parties
SupportDamageProcess.step3Desc: Submit your formal claim through the dashboard with all documentation. Our team reviews each case thoroughly.
SupportDamageProcess.step4Desc: Our team assesses the damage and determines fair resolution based on your coverage level and circumstances.
SupportDamageProcess.basicCoverageDesc: Included with every rental. Covers major incidents with a higher deductible.
SupportDamageProcess.standardProtectionDesc: Reduced deductible for moderate out-of-pocket cost. Recommended for most renters.
SupportDamageProcess.premiumProtectionDesc: Maximum coverage with minimal out-of-pocket. Ideal for luxury vehicles and peace of mind.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion1: What if the damage was there before my trip?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer1: If you documented pre-existing damage during your pre-trip inspection, you won't be held responsible. Always complete the photo checklist before driving.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion2: How long does the claims process take?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer2: Most claims are reviewed within 2-3 business days. Complex cases involving insurance companies may take 1-2 weeks.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion3: Will my security deposit cover damage?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer3: Your security deposit may be used to cover damage costs up to the deposit amount. Any excess is billed separately based on your coverage level.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion4: What if I disagree with the damage assessment?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer4: You can appeal any damage assessment within 7 days. Provide additional photos, documentation, or evidence to support your case.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion5: Do I need to file a police report?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer5: A police report is required for accidents involving other vehicles, theft, or vandalism. For minor damage, it's optional but recommended.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion6: Can I use my personal auto insurance?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer6: Yes! If you have personal auto insurance that covers rental vehicles, you can use it as primary coverage. This may reduce your out-of-pocket costs.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion7: What counts as normal wear and tear?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer7: Minor scratches under 2 inches, small rock chips, and normal tire wear are considered wear and tear. Dents, large scratches, and interior damage are not.
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer8: Costs are based on professional repair estimates from certified shops. ItWhip does not mark up repair costs. You only pay for actual repair expenses minus your coverage.
SupportDamageProcess.emergencyDesc: Call 911 first if anyone is injured. Then contact ItWhip support immediately for assistance.

SupportDeposits.heroSubtitle: Everything you need to know about security deposits — how they work, amounts, and refund timelines.
SupportDeposits.keyPointDesc1: Your security deposit is fully refundable after a clean vehicle return with no damage or violations.
SupportDeposits.keyPointDesc2: Deposits are released within 3-5 business days after your trip ends and the vehicle is inspected.
SupportDeposits.keyPointDesc3: The deposit is an authorization hold on your card, not an actual charge. The funds remain in your account.
SupportDeposits.stepDesc1: When you book, a hold is placed on your payment method for the deposit amount. This is not a charge.
SupportDeposits.stepDesc2: The hold remains on your card throughout your rental period. Your available credit is temporarily reduced.
SupportDeposits.stepDesc3: After returning the vehicle, the host inspects it for damage, cleanliness, and fuel level.
SupportDeposits.stepDesc4: If everything is clear, the hold is released in 3-5 business days. Any issues may result in partial or full deduction.
SupportDeposits.tierDesc1: Most common rental tier with lower deposits
SupportDeposits.tierDesc2: Mid-range vehicles with moderate deposit requirements
SupportDeposits.tierDesc3: High-value vehicles with proportional security deposits
SupportDeposits.depositDisclaimer: Actual deposit amounts are set by individual hosts and may vary. The ranges above are typical guidelines.
SupportDeposits.reduceIntro: You may be able to lower your required security deposit by meeting certain criteria:
SupportDeposits.reduceStep1: Upload proof of personal auto insurance that covers rental vehicles
SupportDeposits.reduceStep2: Complete full identity verification including driver's license
SupportDeposits.reduceStep3: Build a positive rental history with 5-star reviews
SupportDeposits.reduceStep4: Select a higher insurance coverage tier at booking
SupportDeposits.reduceInsuranceNote: Guests with verified personal insurance covering rentals may see deposits reduced by up to 50% on eligible vehicles.
SupportDeposits.deductionsTitle: What Can Be Deducted from Your Deposit
SupportDeposits.deductDesc1: Repair costs for any damage beyond normal wear and tear
SupportDeposits.deductDesc2: Excessive mess, smoking, pet hair, or stains requiring professional cleaning
SupportDeposits.deductDesc3: If the vehicle is returned with less fuel than agreed upon
SupportDeposits.deductDesc4: Additional charges for returning the vehicle past the agreed time
SupportDeposits.deductDesc5: Unpaid tolls or toll processing fees incurred during your trip
SupportDeposits.deductDesc6: Parking tickets or traffic violations received during your rental
SupportDeposits.deductDesc7: Evidence of smoking in a non-smoking vehicle ($150-$250)
SupportDeposits.deductDesc8: Charges for exceeding the daily or total mileage allowance
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer1: Deposits are released within 3-5 business days after your trip ends with no issues. Your bank may take an additional 2-3 days to process the release.
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion2: Why is my deposit higher than expected?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer2: Deposit amounts depend on the vehicle type, your verification level, and insurance coverage. Luxury vehicles require higher deposits due to their value.
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion3: Can I pay the deposit with a different card?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer3: The deposit must be on the same payment method used for the booking. This helps ensure proper authorization and release.
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion4: What if I dispute a deposit deduction?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer4: You can dispute any deduction within 7 days through your dashboard. Provide photos and details from your trip to support your case.
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion5: Is the deposit amount charged to my card?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer5: No, it's an authorization hold, not a charge. The funds remain in your account but your available credit is temporarily reduced.
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion6: Can I use a debit card for the deposit?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer6: Yes, but note that debit card holds may take longer to release (5-10 business days). We recommend using a credit card for faster release times.
SupportDeposits.ctaSubtitle: Our support team can help review deposit holds, deductions, or refund timelines.

SupportExtendRental.title: Extend Your Rental
SupportExtendRental.subtitle: Need more time? Here's how to extend your booking
SupportExtendRental.howToExtendStep1: Open your active booking in the ItWhip app or website
SupportExtendRental.howToExtendStep2: Tap "Request Extension" and select your new return date and time
SupportExtendRental.howToExtendStep3: The host will review and approve your extension request
SupportExtendRental.howToExtendStep4: Once approved, your booking and payment will be updated automatically
SupportExtendRental.howToExtendStep5: You'll receive a confirmation email with the updated booking details
SupportExtendRental.requirement1: Request the extension before your current return time
SupportExtendRental.requirement2: The vehicle must be available for the extended period
SupportExtendRental.requirement3: Your payment method must be valid for additional charges
SupportExtendRental.requirement4: Host approval is required for all extensions
SupportExtendRental.requirement5: Insurance coverage will be extended automatically
SupportExtendRental.pricingDescription: Extension pricing is based on the same daily rate as your original booking, with some adjustments:
SupportExtendRental.pricingItem1: Same daily rate as your original booking applies
SupportExtendRental.pricingItem2: Insurance and protection coverage extends automatically
SupportExtendRental.pricingItem3: Multi-day extension discounts may apply for weekly or monthly rates
SupportExtendRental.lateReturnsDescription: Returning a vehicle late without an approved extension may result in late fees of up to 1.5x the daily rate per hour, plus potential impacts to your renter rating. Always request an extension in advance to avoid these charges.

SupportInsurance.heroSubtitle: Get answers to your insurance questions, learn how to file a claim, and understand your coverage options.
SupportInsurance.claimStep1Desc: Contact ItWhip immediately after any incident. Call our 24/7 claims line or report through the app. Include photos, location, and a description of what happened.
SupportInsurance.claimStep2Desc: Upload all relevant documents including photos of damage, police reports, witness info, and your insurance details through your dashboard.
SupportInsurance.claimStep3Desc: Our claims team reviews your submission, contacts relevant parties, and assesses coverage. You'll receive updates via email throughout the process.
SupportInsurance.claimStep4Desc: Once reviewed, you'll receive the resolution details. Approved claims are processed and any covered amounts are paid out according to your plan.
SupportInsurance.lateReportingWarning: Claims must be filed within 24 hours of the incident. Late reporting may affect claim approval and coverage eligibility.
SupportInsurance.coveredItem1: Collision damage to the rental vehicle
SupportInsurance.coveredItem3: Third-party liability up to policy limits
SupportInsurance.notCoveredItem1: Damage from off-road use or prohibited activities
SupportInsurance.notCoveredItem2: Personal belongings left in the vehicle
SupportInsurance.claimsHierarchyDesc: Claims are processed through the following hierarchy based on your coverage setup:
SupportInsurance.tier1Desc: If you uploaded personal auto insurance, it serves as primary coverage. Your insurer handles the claim first.
SupportInsurance.tier2Desc: Your chosen protection tier kicks in for remaining costs after personal insurance (or as primary if no personal coverage).
SupportInsurance.tier3Desc: The host's commercial policy serves as a final safety net for any remaining covered amounts.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion1: What insurance is included with my rental?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer1: Every ItWhip rental includes $1,000,000 in third-party liability coverage at no extra cost. Additional comprehensive and collision protection can be added during booking.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion2: Can I use my own car insurance?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer2: Yes! Many personal auto policies extend to rental vehicles. Upload proof of your coverage during booking to potentially reduce your security deposit and deductible.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion3: What are the protection plan options?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer3: We offer Basic (included, $2,500 deductible), Standard ($1,000 deductible), and Premium ($250 deductible) protection. Higher tiers reduce your out-of-pocket maximum.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion4: How long does a claim take to process?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer4: Simple claims are typically resolved within 3-5 business days. Complex claims involving multiple parties or personal insurance may take 1-3 weeks.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion5: What if I have a minor scratch or dent?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer5: Minor damage should still be reported. Small scratches under 2 inches are generally considered normal wear and tear, but document everything to be safe.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion6: Does coverage extend to additional drivers?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer6: Coverage applies to the primary renter and any approved additional drivers added to the booking. Unauthorized drivers are not covered.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion7: What's the difference between comprehensive and collision?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer7: Collision covers damage from accidents with other vehicles or objects. Comprehensive covers non-collision events like theft, vandalism, weather damage, and animal strikes.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion8: Am I covered for roadside emergencies?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer8: Yes! Every rental includes 24/7 roadside assistance covering flat tires, dead batteries, lockouts, fuel delivery, and towing up to 25 miles.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion9: What if the other driver was at fault?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer9: If another driver caused the damage, their insurance should cover the costs. ItWhip will help facilitate the claims process with the at-fault party's insurer.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion10: Can I upgrade my coverage mid-trip?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer10: Coverage level is set at booking and cannot be changed mid-trip. For your next rental, you can select a higher protection tier during the booking process.
SupportInsurance.needImmediateHelpDesc: Our insurance claims team is available 24/7 for emergencies. Don't wait — report incidents promptly for the best outcomes.

SupportInsuranceCoverage.pageSubtitle: Understand the protection options available for your rental
SupportInsuranceCoverage.liabilityCoverageDesc: Third-party liability coverage is included with every ItWhip rental at no additional cost. This covers bodily injury and property damage to others.
SupportInsuranceCoverage.liabilityDetail1: Up to $1,000,000 in third-party liability protection
SupportInsuranceCoverage.liabilityDetail2: Covers bodily injury to other people
SupportInsuranceCoverage.liabilityDetail3: Covers property damage to other vehicles and objects
SupportInsuranceCoverage.comprehensiveProtectionDesc: Protects against non-collision damage including theft, vandalism, weather events, fire, and animal strikes.
SupportInsuranceCoverage.collisionProtectionDesc: Covers damage to the rental vehicle from collisions with other vehicles, objects, or single-vehicle accidents.
SupportInsuranceCoverage.byoiDesc: You can use your personal auto insurance as primary coverage for your rental. This may reduce or eliminate the need for additional protection plans.
SupportInsuranceCoverage.byoiReq1: Your policy must explicitly cover rental vehicles
SupportInsuranceCoverage.byoiReq2: Upload a valid declarations page or insurance card during booking
SupportInsuranceCoverage.byoiReq3: Coverage must be active for the entire rental period

SupportModifyReservation.title: Modify a Reservation
SupportModifyReservation.subtitle: Change dates, times, or cancel your booking
SupportModifyReservation.howToModifyStep1: Log in to your account and go to My Trips
SupportModifyReservation.howToModifyStep2: Find the booking you want to modify and tap "Modify Booking"
SupportModifyReservation.howToModifyStep3: Make your desired changes (dates, times, pickup location)
SupportModifyReservation.howToModifyStep4: Review any price adjustments and confirm the changes
SupportModifyReservation.whatCanBeModifiedItem1: Pickup and return dates and times
SupportModifyReservation.importantNotesItem1: Modifications are subject to vehicle availability
SupportModifyReservation.importantNotesItem2: Price may change if dates or times are adjusted
SupportModifyReservation.importantNotesItem3: Host approval may be required for certain changes

SupportPayments.title: Payment Methods
SupportPayments.subtitle: Accepted payment options and security information
SupportPayments.acceptedDebit: Debit cards with Visa or Mastercard logo
SupportPayments.securityDepositsDescription: A security deposit hold is placed on your card at booking. The amount varies by vehicle type and your insurance coverage level:
SupportPayments.depositByoi: BYOI (bring your own insurance): May qualify for reduced deposit
SupportPayments.paymentSecurityDescription: All payments are processed securely through Stripe with PCI Level 1 compliance. Your card information is encrypted and never stored on our servers. We use 3D Secure authentication for added fraud protection.

SupportRoadside.title: Roadside Assistance
SupportRoadside.subtitle: 24/7 help when you need it most
SupportRoadside.emergencyTripIdNote: Have your trip ID ready when you call
SupportRoadside.step1: Pull over to a safe location if possible
SupportRoadside.step3: Provide your trip ID and describe the issue
SupportRoadside.step4: Share your exact location (GPS coordinates or address)
SupportRoadside.step5: Stay with the vehicle until help arrives
SupportRoadside.serviceFlatTireDesc: Tire change or tow to nearest repair shop
SupportRoadside.serviceFuelDeliveryDesc: Emergency fuel delivery to your location
SupportRoadside.responseTimeValue: 30-45 minutes in the Phoenix metro area. Rural areas may take longer. Our dispatch team will provide an ETA when you call.

SupportVehicleIssues.title: Vehicle Issues During Your Trip
SupportVehicleIssues.subtitle: What to do if you experience problems with your rental
SupportVehicleIssues.emergencyDescription: Call 911 immediately if you feel unsafe. Then call ItWhip at (602) 609-2577 for vehicle assistance.
SupportVehicleIssues.firstStepsTitle: First Steps When You Encounter an Issue
SupportVehicleIssues.firstStep1: Pull over safely and turn on your hazard lights
SupportVehicleIssues.firstStep2: Document the issue with photos and notes
SupportVehicleIssues.firstStep4: Follow the support team's instructions for next steps
SupportVehicleIssues.issueFlatTireDesc: Call roadside assistance for a tire change or tow. Do not attempt to drive on a flat tire as it may cause additional damage.
SupportVehicleIssues.issueDeadBatteryDesc: Call roadside assistance for a jump start. If the battery fails repeatedly, we'll arrange a vehicle swap.
SupportVehicleIssues.issueCheckEngineDesc: Note any warning lights and contact support. If the vehicle is still drivable, you may continue cautiously to your destination while support arranges resolution.
SupportVehicleIssues.issueStrangeNoisesDesc: Pull over safely and do not continue driving. Contact support immediately. Unusual noises or handling issues may indicate a safety concern.
SupportVehicleIssues.issueAccidentDesc: Call 911 if anyone is injured. Exchange information with other parties. Take photos of all vehicles and the scene. Contact ItWhip support to start the claims process.

SupportVerification.pageSubtitle: Complete your verification to start renting
SupportVerification.phoneVerificationDesc: Verify your phone number with a one-time SMS code. This helps us keep your account secure and enables trip notifications.
SupportVerification.identityVerificationDesc: Complete a selfie check powered by Stripe Identity. This matches your face to your driver's license for security.
SupportVerification.driversLicenseDesc: Upload a photo of your valid driver's license. We verify it's current, matches your identity, and meets our rental requirements.
SupportVerification.requirement1: Must be at least 21 years old (25 for luxury/exotic vehicles)
SupportVerification.requirement2: Valid driver's license held for at least 1 year
SupportVerification.requirement3: Clean driving record with no major violations in the past 3 years
SupportVerification.requirement4: Valid credit or debit card in the renter's name
SupportVerification.requirement5: International renters: International Driving Permit (IDP) may be required

PlatformAgreement.pageSubtitle: This agreement governs your use of the ItWhip peer-to-peer car sharing marketplace.
PlatformAgreement.importantNoticeDesc: By using ItWhip, you agree to this Platform Agreement, our Terms of Service, and Privacy Policy. Please read all documents carefully before using our services. If you do not agree with any terms, do not use the platform.
PlatformAgreement.sectionOverviewContent:
This Platform Agreement ("Agreement") governs your use of the ItWhip peer-to-peer car sharing marketplace. By using our platform, you agree to these terms.

ItWhip Technologies, Inc. ("ItWhip") operates a technology platform that connects vehicle owners ("Hosts") with individuals seeking to rent vehicles ("Guests"). We facilitate transactions but do not own or operate any vehicles listed on our platform.

KEY PLATFORM CHARACTERISTICS:
• ItWhip is a marketplace facilitator, not a rental car company
• All vehicles are independently owned and operated by Hosts
• We provide technology, payment processing, and support services
• Insurance coverage is provided through our partner programs
• We verify identities and facilitate trust between parties
PlatformAgreement.sectionUserResponsibilitiesContent:
2.1 HOST RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Host on ItWhip, you agree to:
• Maintain your vehicle in safe, roadworthy condition
• Provide accurate vehicle descriptions and photos
• Keep insurance coverage current and compliant
• Respond to booking requests within 24 hours
• Complete pre-trip and post-trip inspections
• Report any incidents or damage promptly
• Comply with all local laws and regulations

2.2 GUEST RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Guest on ItWhip, you agree to:
• Meet all eligibility and verification requirements
• Use vehicles only for lawful purposes
• Return vehicles on time and in original condition
• Report any accidents or damage immediately
• Not allow unauthorized drivers to operate the vehicle
• Follow all mileage and geographic restrictions
• Pay for fuel, tolls, and any incurred charges
PlatformAgreement.sectionBookingTermsContent:
3.1 BOOKING PROCESS

All bookings are subject to:
• Host approval (unless Instant Book is enabled)
• Payment authorization and security deposit hold
• Successful identity and driving record verification
• Vehicle availability at time of confirmation

3.2 CANCELLATION POLICY

Standard Cancellation Terms:
• Free cancellation up to 24 hours before trip start
• 50% refund for cancellations 12-24 hours before
• No refund for cancellations less than 12 hours before
• Host cancellations may result in penalties and account review

3.3 TRIP MODIFICATIONS

• Extensions require Host approval and availability
• Early returns may be subject to minimum booking fees
• Location changes must be agreed upon by both parties
• Rate changes may apply for modifications
PlatformAgreement.sectionPaymentsContent:
4.1 GUEST PAYMENTS

Guests are responsible for:
• Daily rental rate set by Host
• Service fees (percentage of booking total)
• Security deposit (refundable if no damage/violations)
• Young driver surcharge (if applicable)
• Additional driver fees
• Mileage overage charges
• Fuel replacement costs
• Cleaning fees (if vehicle returned dirty)
• Toll charges and parking violations

4.2 HOST EARNINGS

Hosts receive:
• 40-90% of rental rate based on insurance tier
• Payment within 3 business days of trip completion
• Direct deposit to linked bank account

4.3 SECURITY DEPOSITS

• Standard deposit: $250-$500 (varies by vehicle)
• Luxury/Exotic vehicles: $1,000-$5,000
• Deposits are authorization holds, not charges
• Released within 3-5 business days if no claims
PlatformAgreement.sectionInsuranceContent:
5.1 COVERAGE TIERS

ItWhip offers tiered protection:

BASIC (Platform Insurance):
• $50,000 liability coverage
• $35,000 property damage
• Guest pays 40% of rental to Host

STANDARD (P2P Insurance):
• $100,000 liability coverage
• $50,000 property damage
• Guest pays 75% of rental to Host

PREMIUM (Commercial Insurance):
• $1,000,000 liability coverage
• $100,000 property damage
• Guest pays 90% of rental to Host

5.2 EXCLUSIONS

Coverage does NOT apply to:
• Intentional damage or misuse
• Driving under influence of drugs/alcohol
• Unauthorized drivers
• Off-road or track use
• Commercial use without disclosure
• Violation of geographic restrictions
PlatformAgreement.sectionLiabilityContent:
6.1 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

ItWhip's liability is limited to:
• The amount of fees paid to ItWhip in the 12 months preceding any claim
• We are not liable for actions of Hosts or Guests
• We are not liable for vehicle defects or accidents
• We are not liable for personal belongings left in vehicles

6.2 DISPUTE RESOLUTION

Disputes between Hosts and Guests:
• First, attempt resolution through ItWhip Support
• Unresolved disputes may be escalated to arbitration
• Class action waiver applies to all users
• Small claims court remains available

6.3 DAMAGE CLAIMS

Process for damage claims:
• Report within 24 hours of trip end
• Provide photos and documentation
• ItWhip reviews and makes determination
• Appeals may be submitted within 7 days
PlatformAgreement.sectionProhibitedContent:
The following are strictly prohibited:

VEHICLE USE PROHIBITIONS:
• Street racing or speed competitions
• Rideshare or delivery services (without disclosure)
• Transporting illegal substances
• Towing or pushing other vehicles
• Off-road driving (unless specifically authorized)
• International travel (without prior approval)
• Subleasing or re-renting the vehicle

PLATFORM PROHIBITIONS:
• Creating fake accounts or listings
• Circumventing the platform for bookings
• Harassment of other users
• Posting false or misleading information
• Manipulation of reviews or ratings
• Unauthorized data collection

VIOLATIONS MAY RESULT IN:
• Immediate account suspension
• Forfeiture of security deposit
• Legal action where applicable
• Permanent platform ban
PlatformAgreement.sectionTerminationContent:
8.1 VOLUNTARY TERMINATION

You may close your account at any time:
• Complete all active bookings first
• Outstanding balances must be settled
• Request account deletion through Settings

8.2 INVOLUNTARY TERMINATION

ItWhip may suspend or terminate accounts for:
• Violation of this Agreement
• Fraudulent activity
• Safety concerns
• Multiple negative reviews
• Failure to maintain insurance (Hosts)
• Criminal activity

8.3 EFFECT OF TERMINATION

Upon termination:
• Access to platform is immediately revoked
• Pending payouts will be processed
• Outstanding charges remain due
• Reviews and data may be retained
PlatformAgreement.sectionPrivacyContent:
9.1 DATA COLLECTION

We collect and process:
• Identity verification information
• Driving history and records
• Payment and billing information
• Location data during active trips
• Communications between users
• Device and usage analytics

9.2 DATA SHARING

Your information may be shared with:
• The other party in a booking (limited info)
• Insurance providers for claims
• Law enforcement when legally required
• Service providers who assist our operations

9.3 YOUR RIGHTS

You have the right to:
• Access your personal data
• Request correction of inaccurate data
• Request deletion (subject to legal requirements)
• Opt out of marketing communications
• Export your data

See our Privacy Policy for complete details.
PlatformAgreement.sectionUpdatesContent:
10.1 MODIFICATIONS

ItWhip may modify this Agreement at any time:
• Material changes will be communicated via email
• Continued use constitutes acceptance
• You may terminate if you disagree with changes

10.2 GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement is governed by:
• Laws of the State of Arizona
• Federal Arbitration Act for arbitration provisions
• Venue in Maricopa County, Arizona

10.3 CONTACT

For questions about this Agreement:
• Email: info@itwhip.com
• Mail: ItWhip Technologies, Inc., Phoenix, AZ

Last Updated: December 2024
PlatformAgreement.contactDesc: Contact our legal team for clarification on any terms.

HostPayouts.heroDescription: Secure, transparent payouts powered by Stripe Connect. Earn up to 90% on every trip with direct deposit in 2-3 business days.
HostPayouts.setupDescription: Connect your bank account through Stripe and start earning. Quick, secure onboarding with no upfront costs.
HostPayouts.step1Description: Sign up and verify your identity. We use Stripe's secure identity verification.
HostPayouts.step2Description: Confirm your business type (individual or company) and tax information.
HostPayouts.step3Description: Connect your bank account or debit card for direct deposits.
HostPayouts.step4Description: Your account is ready. Payouts begin after your first completed trip.

HostPayouts.whyStripe2: Bank-level 256-bit AES encryption for all financial data
HostPayouts.whyStripe3: PCI DSS Level 1 certified — the highest level of payment security
HostPayouts.whyStripe4: Real-time fraud detection and prevention powered by machine learning
HostPayouts.whyStripe5: Support for instant payouts to eligible debit cards
HostPayouts.timelineStep1Desc: Guest returns car, trip ends successfully
HostPayouts.instantPayoutBannerDesc: Eligible hosts can enable Instant Payouts to receive funds in minutes instead of days. Available for eligible debit cards with a small fee.
HostPayouts.earningsDescription: Your earnings depend on what insurance coverage you bring to the platform.
HostPayouts.planBasicFeature1: No insurance needed — platform provides all coverage
HostPayouts.planStandardFeature1: Bring your own P2P insurance policy
HostPayouts.planStandardFeature2: State Farm, USAA, or similar P2P coverage
HostPayouts.scheduledPayoutFeature1: Set a weekly or monthly schedule
HostPayouts.dashboardDescription: Track every dollar in your host dashboard. See pending payouts, completed transfers, and earnings history at a glance.
HostPayouts.taxDescription: We handle the heavy lifting. Stripe automatically generates your tax documents and we provide detailed earnings summaries for your accountant.
HostPayouts.taxFeature4: Integration with TurboTax and popular tax software
HostPayouts.taxDeductionsLink: Explore tax deductions for car sharing hosts
HostPayouts.faq1Question: When do I get paid after a trip?
HostPayouts.faq1Answer: Payouts are processed 1-2 business days after a trip ends. For bank transfers (ACH), funds arrive in 2-3 business days. Instant payouts to eligible debit cards arrive in minutes.
HostPayouts.faq2Answer: Your earnings depend on your insurance tier. Platform Coverage hosts keep 40%, P2P Coverage hosts keep 75%, and Commercial Coverage hosts keep 90%. The more coverage you bring, the more you earn.
HostPayouts.faq3Question: Is there a minimum payout amount?
HostPayouts.faq3Answer: The minimum payout amount is $1.00. Stripe processes payouts regardless of the amount, so you'll receive your earnings even from short rentals.
HostPayouts.faq4Question: How do I enable instant payouts?
HostPayouts.faq4Answer: In your dashboard, go to Payouts > Settings and add an eligible Visa or Mastercard debit card. Instant payouts have a 1% fee and funds arrive within minutes.
HostPayouts.faq5Answer: Stripe automatically generates a 1099-K if you earn over $600 in a calendar year. We also provide detailed annual earnings summaries and per-trip breakdowns for easy tax filing.
HostPayouts.ctaDescription: Join hosts earning up to 90% on every trip. Setup takes less than 5 minutes.

HostTaxBenefits.recordKeepingSoftwareDescription: Software like TurboTax Self-Employed or H&R Block can import your 1099-K and simplify filing.

HostInsuranceOptions.heroSubtitle: Your earnings depend on what insurance you bring. Choose your tier, understand your coverage, and maximize your income.
HostInsuranceOptions.tiersSubheading: Your earnings percentage is determined by the insurance coverage you bring to the platform.
HostInsuranceOptions.tier1Description: No insurance needed. ItWhip provides comprehensive coverage for every trip. Ideal for new hosts getting started.
HostInsuranceOptions.tier2Description: Bring your own peer-to-peer insurance policy (State Farm, USAA, etc). Platform provides gap coverage.
HostInsuranceOptions.tier3Description: Bring commercial auto insurance for maximum earnings. Lowest platform fee at just 10%.
HostInsuranceOptions.hierarchyIntro: Every trip on ItWhip has multiple layers of protection. The coverage hierarchy determines which insurance pays first in case of a claim.
HostInsuranceOptions.hierarchyPrimarySubtitle: Your personal, P2P, or commercial policy
HostInsuranceOptions.layersCombineItem1: Host's insurance pays first (if applicable), then platform coverage kicks in
HostInsuranceOptions.layersCombineItem2: For Tier 1 hosts, the platform is the primary insurer for the entire claim
HostInsuranceOptions.layersCombineItem3: Excess liability coverage applies to all tiers up to $1M
HostInsuranceOptions.layersCombineItem4: Mileage Forensics™ data helps expedite claims processing
HostInsuranceOptions.commercialHostsDescription: If you carry commercial auto insurance, your policy serves as primary. ItWhip's platform coverage acts as excess, giving you the maximum 90% earnings rate.
HostInsuranceOptions.guestProtectionDescription: Every guest is automatically covered by our protection plan, included in the rental price.
HostInsuranceOptions.securityDepositsDescription: Refundable security deposits protect hosts against damage. Amount varies by vehicle class.
HostInsuranceOptions.declarationsIntro: When listing your car, you'll declare how the vehicle is used. This affects your insurance requirements and helps carriers assess risk accurately.
HostInsuranceOptions.declarationRentalDesc: Vehicle is used exclusively for peer-to-peer rental on ItWhip
HostInsuranceOptions.declarationRentalMileage: All miles tracked via Mileage Forensics™
HostInsuranceOptions.declarationMixedDesc: Vehicle is used for both personal driving and P2P rental
HostInsuranceOptions.declarationMixedMileage: Rental miles separated from personal miles
HostInsuranceOptions.declarationCommercialDesc: Vehicle is part of a commercial fleet with dedicated insurance
HostInsuranceOptions.declarationCommercialMileage: Full fleet mileage tracking and reporting
HostInsuranceOptions.mileageForensicsNotice: Mileage Forensics™ automatically tracks and separates rental miles from personal miles, providing verified data that insurance carriers can use for accurate risk assessment and claims processing.
HostInsuranceOptions.faq1Question: Do I need my own insurance to host on ItWhip?
HostInsuranceOptions.faq1Answer: No! Tier 1 (Platform Coverage) provides full insurance with no personal policy required. However, bringing your own P2P or commercial insurance earns you a higher percentage (75% or 90%).
HostInsuranceOptions.faq2Question: What happens if a guest damages my car?
HostInsuranceOptions.faq2Answer: All trips include collision and comprehensive coverage. The guest's security deposit covers minor damage, and our insurance covers larger claims. Mileage Forensics™ data helps verify what happened during the trip.
HostInsuranceOptions.faq3Question: How does Mileage Forensics™ help with insurance?
HostInsuranceOptions.faq3Answer: Mileage Forensics™ provides GPS-verified trip data that separates rental miles from personal miles. This verified data helps insurance carriers assess risk accurately and process claims faster.
HostInsuranceOptions.faq4Question: Can I switch between insurance tiers?
HostInsuranceOptions.faq4Answer: Yes! You can change your tier at any time. If you get a P2P or commercial policy, update your tier to earn a higher percentage. Changes take effect on your next new booking.
HostInsuranceOptions.faq5Question: What's the deductible if there's a claim?
HostInsuranceOptions.faq5Answer: Deductibles vary by tier. Tier 1: $2,500 collision / $1,000 comprehensive. Tier 2: $1,000 collision / $500 comprehensive. Tier 3: per your commercial policy terms.
HostInsuranceOptions.faq6Question: Does the guest pay for insurance?
HostInsuranceOptions.faq6Answer: Guest protection is included in the rental price — there's no separate insurance charge for guests. They're automatically covered by $1M combined liability plus collision and comprehensive coverage.
HostInsuranceOptions.ctaDescription: Choose the tier that works for you and start earning. You can always upgrade your insurance later to earn more.

HostFleetOwners.heroDescription: The only P2P car sharing platform with Mileage Forensics™, ESG reporting, and insurance intelligence built in. Designed for fleets of 5+ vehicles.
HostFleetOwners.challengeSectionDescription: Fleet operators face growing complexity. ItWhip's technology stack turns these challenges into competitive advantages.
HostFleetOwners.challengeRegulatoryPressureDescription: Evolving state and federal regulations require accurate mileage reporting and compliance documentation.
HostFleetOwners.challengeRisingInsuranceCostsDescription: Insurance premiums continue to climb. Carriers need better data to offer competitive fleet rates.

RideshareMake.metaTitle: {make} Rideshare Rentals Phoenix | Uber & Lyft Approved | ItWhip
RideshareMake.toyotaDescription: Rent Toyota rideshare vehicles in Phoenix. Camry, Corolla, and Prius approved for Uber & Lyft. Industry-leading reliability for gig drivers.
RideshareMake.toyotaLongDescription: Toyota is the #1 choice for rideshare drivers nationwide. Our Phoenix Toyota rideshare fleet includes the legendary Camry, fuel-efficient Prius, and reliable Corolla—all pre-approved for Uber and Lyft with full commercial insurance coverage.
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq0Question: Why is Toyota the most popular brand for Uber and Lyft drivers?
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq0Answer: Toyota vehicles consistently rank #1 among rideshare drivers due to their legendary reliability, excellent fuel economy (especially hybrids like the Prius), low maintenance costs, and high passenger comfort ratings. The Camry and Prius are the two most common vehicles seen on Uber and Lyft platforms nationwide.
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq1Question: What Toyota models are approved for rideshare in Phoenix?
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq1Answer: All Toyota sedans and SUVs in our fleet are pre-approved for both Uber and Lyft in Phoenix. Popular choices include the Camry (most requested), Corolla (budget-friendly), Prius (best fuel economy), and RAV4 (for UberXL/Lyft XL). Each vehicle meets platform requirements for year, doors, and seating.
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq2Question: How much can I earn driving Uber/Lyft with a Toyota rental?
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq2Answer: Phoenix rideshare drivers typically earn $1,200-2,500+ per week gross before expenses. With a Toyota’s excellent fuel economy (30-50+ MPG depending on model), your net earnings are maximized. Many drivers report covering their weekly rental cost within the first 2-3 days of driving.
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq3Question: Does the Toyota rideshare rental include insurance for Uber and Lyft?
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq3Answer: Yes! All our rideshare rentals include comprehensive commercial insurance that covers you while driving for Uber, Lyft, or both platforms simultaneously. This is full coverage—not a gap policy—so you’re protected from pickup to dropoff.
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq4Question: Can I use this Toyota for both Uber and Lyft at the same time?
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq4Answer: Absolutely! Our rideshare rentals allow you to drive for multiple platforms including Uber, Lyft, DoorDash, Instacart, and Amazon Flex. Maximize your earnings by switching between apps based on demand and surge pricing.
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq5Question: What’s included in the weekly Toyota rideshare rental?
RideshareMake.toyotaFaq5Answer: Every rental includes: commercial rideshare insurance, unlimited miles, 24/7 roadside assistance, regular maintenance, and vehicle registration. You just pay for gas. We also provide a pre-inspection report documenting the vehicle’s condition for your protection.
RideshareMake.hondaDescription: Rent Honda rideshare vehicles in Phoenix. Accord and Civic approved for Uber & Lyft. Driver’s choice for comfort and reliability.
RideshareMake.hondaLongDescription: Honda is the driver’s choice for rideshare. Our Phoenix Honda fleet features the spacious Accord, efficient Civic, and versatile CR-V—all approved for Uber and Lyft with comprehensive commercial insurance included.
RideshareMake.hondaFaq0Question: Why do rideshare drivers prefer Honda vehicles?
RideshareMake.hondaFaq0Answer: Honda vehicles are prized by rideshare drivers for their exceptional reliability, smooth ride quality, and spacious interiors. The Accord consistently receives 5-star passenger ratings due to its comfortable back seat, quiet cabin, and refined driving experience. Honda’s VTEC engines are known for longevity—many reach 300,000+ miles.
RideshareMake.hondaFaq1Question: What Honda models work best for Uber and Lyft in Phoenix?
RideshareMake.hondaFaq1Answer: The Honda Accord is our most popular rideshare vehicle—passengers love the spacious interior and smooth ride. The Civic offers excellent fuel economy for budget-conscious drivers, while the CR-V qualifies for UberXL/Lyft XL with its extra space. All Honda models in our fleet meet platform requirements.
RideshareMake.hondaFaq2Question: How does Honda fuel economy compare for rideshare driving?
RideshareMake.hondaFaq2Answer: Honda vehicles deliver excellent fuel economy: Civic averages 32-36 MPG, Accord 30-33 MPG, and Accord Hybrid reaches 48 MPG. In Phoenix’s stop-and-go traffic, this translates to significant savings—typically $50-100+ per week compared to less efficient vehicles.
RideshareMake.hondaFaq3Question: Is the Honda rental approved for both Uber and Lyft?
RideshareMake.hondaFaq3Answer: Yes! Every Honda in our rideshare fleet is pre-approved for Uber, Lyft, and other gig platforms. We handle all the paperwork and ensure each vehicle meets platform requirements for year, condition, and safety features.
RideshareMake.hondaFaq4Question: What insurance coverage comes with the Honda rideshare rental?
RideshareMake.hondaFaq4Answer: All rentals include comprehensive commercial insurance covering rideshare driving. This includes liability, collision, comprehensive, and uninsured motorist coverage while you’re on the platform. No gaps in coverage—you’re protected from the moment you accept a ride until dropoff.
RideshareMake.hondaFaq5Question: Can I switch between different gig apps with my Honda rental?
RideshareMake.hondaFaq5Answer: Yes! Our rideshare rentals support multi-app driving. Use your Honda for Uber, Lyft, DoorDash, UberEats, Instacart, Amazon Flex, and more. Many drivers maximize earnings by running multiple apps based on demand.
RideshareMake.hyundaiDescription: Rent Hyundai rideshare vehicles in Phoenix. Elantra and Sonata approved for Uber & Lyft. Best value for new rideshare drivers.
RideshareMake.hyundaiLongDescription: Hyundai offers the best value for rideshare drivers. Our Phoenix Hyundai fleet includes the efficient Elantra, refined Sonata, and spacious Santa Fe—all with modern features, excellent warranties, and full rideshare approval.
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq0Question: Why is Hyundai a great choice for new rideshare drivers?
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq0Answer: Hyundai offers the best value entry point for rideshare. Their vehicles feature modern technology, excellent fuel economy, and comfortable interiors at lower price points than competitors. The Elantra and Sonata both earn high passenger ratings while keeping your operating costs low.
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq1Question: What Hyundai models are available for rideshare in Phoenix?
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq1Answer: Our Hyundai rideshare fleet includes the Elantra (most affordable option), Sonata (premium comfort), Tucson (for UberXL), and Elantra Hybrid (best fuel economy). All vehicles are 2020 or newer and meet Uber/Lyft requirements.
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq2Question: How much money can I save with Hyundai’s fuel efficiency?
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq2Answer: Hyundai vehicles are engineered for efficiency. The Elantra achieves 33-37 MPG, Sonata 28-32 MPG, and Elantra Hybrid hits 54 MPG combined. At Phoenix gas prices, efficient drivers save $75-150 per week on fuel costs compared to older or larger vehicles.
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq3Question: Does the Hyundai rental include rideshare insurance?
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq3Answer: Yes! All Hyundai rideshare rentals include comprehensive commercial insurance covering Uber, Lyft, and delivery platforms. You’re fully covered from pickup to dropoff with no gaps in protection.
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq4Question: What modern features do Hyundai rideshare vehicles include?
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq4Answer: Our Hyundai fleet includes vehicles with Apple CarPlay/Android Auto, backup cameras, blind spot monitoring, lane keeping assist, and USB charging ports for passengers. These features help you earn higher ratings and more tips.
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq5Question: Can I use the Hyundai for food delivery apps too?
RideshareMake.hyundaiFaq5Answer: Absolutely! Your Hyundai rental can be used for Uber, Lyft, DoorDash, UberEats, Grubhub, Instacart, Shipt, and Amazon Flex. Mix rideshare with delivery to maximize your daily earnings.
RideshareMake.kiaDescription: Rent Kia rideshare vehicles in Phoenix. Forte and K5 approved for Uber & Lyft. Most affordable rideshare option in Arizona.
RideshareMake.kiaLongDescription: Kia provides the most affordable path to rideshare driving. Our Phoenix Kia fleet features the budget-friendly Forte, stylish K5, and versatile Sportage—all with impressive features, great fuel economy, and full rideshare approval.
RideshareMake.kiaFaq0Question: Why is Kia the most affordable rideshare rental option?
RideshareMake.kiaFaq0Answer: Kia vehicles offer exceptional value with lower operating costs than competitors. The Forte and K5 deliver great fuel economy, low maintenance costs, and reliable performance at our lowest weekly rates. This means you keep more of every dollar you earn driving rideshare.
RideshareMake.kiaFaq1Question: What Kia models qualify for Uber and Lyft?
RideshareMake.kiaFaq1Answer: Our Kia rideshare fleet includes the Forte (most affordable), K5 (premium sedan), Sportage (for UberXL/Lyft XL), and Soul (compact and efficient). All vehicles meet platform age and condition requirements, with modern safety features included.
RideshareMake.kiaFaq2Question: How quickly can I pay off my Kia rental with rideshare earnings?
RideshareMake.kiaFaq2Answer: Most drivers cover their Kia rental in the first 2 days of driving. At $249/week, you only need 25-30 rides to break even. Everything after that is profit. Phoenix’s strong rideshare demand means active drivers can earn $800-1,500+ per week after rental costs.
RideshareMake.kiaFaq3Question: Is the Kia covered for rideshare insurance?
RideshareMake.kiaFaq3Answer: Yes! Every Kia rental includes comprehensive commercial insurance for Uber, Lyft, and delivery platforms. No additional insurance purchase required—you’re fully covered while working any gig app.
RideshareMake.kiaFaq4Question: What features come standard in Kia rideshare vehicles?
RideshareMake.kiaFaq4Answer: Kia vehicles punch above their weight in features. Expect Apple CarPlay/Android Auto, backup camera, USB ports for passengers, Bluetooth, and modern safety tech. The K5 adds a premium interior that earns higher passenger ratings.
RideshareMake.kiaFaq5Question: Can I start driving immediately after picking up my Kia?
RideshareMake.kiaFaq5Answer: Yes! We handle all the vehicle registration and insurance documentation. Once you pick up your Kia, you can immediately go online with Uber, Lyft, or any delivery app. We’ll provide all documents needed for platform verification.
RideshareMake.nissanDescription: Rent Nissan rideshare vehicles in Phoenix. Altima and Sentra approved for Uber & Lyft. Fleet-proven reliability for professional drivers.
RideshareMake.nissanLongDescription: Nissan is fleet-proven for professional rideshare driving. Our Phoenix Nissan fleet includes the comfortable Altima, efficient Sentra, and spacious Rogue—trusted by commercial fleets and individual drivers alike.
RideshareMake.nissanFaq0Question: Why do fleet operators choose Nissan for rideshare?
RideshareMake.nissanFaq0Answer: Nissan vehicles are proven in commercial fleet applications. The Altima and Sentra offer durable CVT transmissions, comfortable interiors, and reliable performance over high mileage. Many fleet operators choose Nissan specifically for rideshare due to their balance of comfort, efficiency, and longevity.
RideshareMake.nissanFaq1Question: What Nissan models are available for rideshare in Phoenix?
RideshareMake.nissanFaq1Answer: Our Nissan rideshare fleet includes the Altima (mid-size comfort), Sentra (compact efficiency), Rogue (for UberXL/Lyft XL), and Kicks (urban nimble). All vehicles are rideshare-approved and maintained to fleet standards.
RideshareMake.nissanFaq2Question: How does the Nissan CVT transmission perform for rideshare?
RideshareMake.nissanFaq2Answer: Nissan’s CVT transmission is optimized for fuel efficiency in stop-and-go driving—exactly what rideshare requires. Drivers report smooth acceleration, quiet operation, and fuel economy improvements of 10-15% compared to traditional automatics. Modern Nissan CVTs are proven reliable to 200,000+ miles.
RideshareMake.nissanFaq3Question: Is my Nissan rental covered for Uber and Lyft driving?
RideshareMake.nissanFaq3Answer: Yes! All Nissan rideshare rentals include comprehensive commercial insurance covering both platforms plus delivery apps. Full coverage from pickup to dropoff with no gaps in protection.
RideshareMake.nissanFaq4Question: What technology features do Nissan rideshare vehicles include?
RideshareMake.nissanFaq4Answer: Our Nissan fleet includes vehicles with NissanConnect infotainment, Apple CarPlay/Android Auto, Pro-PILOT assist (on select models), around-view monitor, and USB/wireless charging. These features enhance both driver convenience and passenger experience.
RideshareMake.nissanFaq5Question: How does Nissan maintenance work with the rental?
RideshareMake.nissanFaq5Answer: All routine maintenance is included in your rental—oil changes, tire rotations, brake inspections, and more. We maintain our Nissans to fleet standards, ensuring reliable performance. If any issue arises, our 24/7 roadside assistance has you covered.
RideshareMake.chevroletDescription: Rent Chevrolet rideshare vehicles in Phoenix. Malibu and Equinox approved for Uber & Lyft. American-made reliability for Arizona drivers.
RideshareMake.chevroletLongDescription: Chevrolet brings American reliability to rideshare. Our Phoenix Chevy fleet includes the smooth-riding Malibu, versatile Equinox, and efficient Trax—American-made vehicles trusted by rideshare drivers across the country.
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq0Question: Why choose Chevrolet for rideshare driving?
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq0Answer: Chevrolet offers American-made reliability with a strong dealer network for support. The Malibu provides a smooth, quiet ride that passengers appreciate, while the Equinox offers extra space for UberXL/Lyft XL earnings. Chevy vehicles are known for dependable performance and comfortable interiors.
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq1Question: What Chevrolet models are approved for rideshare in Phoenix?
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq1Answer: Our Chevrolet rideshare fleet includes the Malibu (sedan comfort), Equinox (versatile SUV), Trax (compact efficient), and select Bolt EVs (zero gas costs). All meet Uber and Lyft platform requirements and are maintained to professional fleet standards.
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq2Question: How does the Chevy Malibu perform for full-time rideshare?
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq2Answer: The Malibu is engineered for comfort on long drives. Features like a quiet cabin, smooth suspension, and spacious rear seat earn high passenger ratings. The turbocharged engine delivers good power while achieving 29-36 MPG, making it economical for full-time rideshare work.
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq3Question: Is the Chevrolet rental covered for commercial rideshare use?
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq3Answer: Yes! All Chevrolet rentals include comprehensive commercial insurance covering Uber, Lyft, DoorDash, and other gig platforms. You’re protected with full coverage—liability, collision, and comprehensive—while working.
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq4Question: What about the Chevy Bolt EV for rideshare?
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq4Answer: Select locations offer the Bolt EV for rideshare drivers wanting zero gas costs. With 259 miles of range, you can complete a full day of driving on one charge. Combined with Phoenix’s charging infrastructure and our included insurance, the Bolt offers a unique proposition for eco-conscious drivers.
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq5Question: What support does Chevrolet’s dealer network provide?
RideshareMake.chevroletFaq5Answer: Chevrolet has one of the largest dealer networks in America, meaning parts and service are readily available. For routine maintenance included in your rental, we handle everything at certified facilities. For unexpected issues, 24/7 roadside assistance gets you back on the road fast.
